In particular, they have two milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese production, and a horse. In addition, they have two hectares of agricultural land, where maize and nut trees are grown. They sell the harvested products and cheese locally in an open market at a good price. Inga is a very hardworking young woman and has a rich experience in her business. She requested a loan to build a greenhouse. After the greenhouse is built, she will be able to sow greens and cucumbers and sell them locally. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income they will be able to improve their living conditions. Inga awaits your support.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Bakur

texts.en:
Bakur is 23 years old. He lives in the small village of Ushapati with his wife and father. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have an ox and a pig. Also, Bakur grows nuts and maize on the family-owned land. He sells the harvested products and piglets seasonally. In addition, Bakur works at nut factory and gets a monthly salary. 
He is a very hardworking young man and has a great desire to get ahead. Bakur requested a loan to purchase a milk cow. After purchasing a milk cow, he will be able to receive milk. With the received milk, his wife will produce cheese and sell it locally for a good price. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income they will be able to improve their living conditions. Bakur awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 49 years old. She lives with her 21-year-old son in the small village of Senaki district. She is involved in agricultural activities. 

In particular, Nino has two milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese production. She also has a pig. In addition, she has a vineyard, where 50 samples of vine trees are grown. She sells piglets, cheese, and wine locally, at a good price. She is a very hard-working woman and has a rich experience in her business. 

Nino requested a loan for purchasing a plot of agricultural land. After purchasing the land, she will be able to grow nut trees and increase the income of the family. With the increased income, she will improve their living conditions. Nino awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land to grow nut trees.

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es:
Gonzalo de 43 años comparte una vida conyugal junto a Eudolia de 42 años, ambos conforman un hogar con 5 hijos cuyo trabajo y esfuerzo son dedicados íntegramente para el bienestar de ellos.
Reside en una vivienda construida a base de madera adquirida desde hace muchos años. 
Desde joven fue instruido por sus padres en las diversas actividades productivas de cacao y café orgánico descubriendo así su vocación de trabajo. Posteriormente al cumplir la mayoría de edad gracias al mérito logrado obtuvo su primera parcela heredado por sus padres con el que en adelante tendría la misión de sacar adelante a su familia. Es así que todas las mañanas, él y su familia se dirige a sus cultivos para darle el mantenimiento respectivo a los árboles de cacao, pues de ello depende para que sus ganancias aumenten, pues los acopiadores de la zona pagan por producto bueno.
Como la temporada de lluvias es constante en esta época del año, requiere contar con capital para el mantenimiento y compra de insumos para garantizar una producción de calidad.
Sus planes a futuro apuntan a incursionar en un negocio consistente en una pequeña tienda de abarrotes poniendo a cargo a su esposa para de esa manera crear un nuevo ingreso en beneficio de su economía familiar.
En esta ocasión requiere contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de sacos con abono orgánico para aportar a una crecimiento eficiente de sus árboles cacaoteros.
texts.en:
Gonzalo, 43, shares his married life with Eudolia, 42; they form a home with five children.  All his work and effort is entirely devoted to their well-being.  He lives in a wood house he acquired many years ago.  

As a youth, he was taught by his parents how do to the various productive activities related to cocoa bean and organic coffee growing thus discovering his work vocation.  Later, when he became an adult, thanks to his accomplishments he obtained his first plot of land passed down from his parents which from then on would be his source of family support.  He thus rises every morning and with his family heads out to his crops to provide care for his cocoa bean trees because that’s what obtaining higher profits depends on because local crop consolidators pay good prices for good product.  Because the rains are constant during this season of the year, he needs to have capital for crop maintenance and to buy supplies needed to guarantee a good quality harvest.

His future plans point towards starting a new business: a grocery store his wife can manage so the family can have a new source of income.  On this occasion, he needs to have 1,000 new soles to buy sacks of organic manure so his cocoa bean trees can grow properly.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Emerson

texts.es:
Emerson tiene 28 años, soltero y sin hijos. Se caracteriza por tener una gran responsabilidad laboral, actualmente reside en una vivienda construida a base de material noble en calidad de alquiler. Desempeñó estudios superiores en contabilidad, al culminar su instrucción logró ser admitido en un establecimiento de salud público de su localidad en donde se desempeña desde hace 1 año y 10 meses.
Comenta que le agrada su labor puesto que ha conocido a grandes compañeros de trabajo y aprendido muchas cosas nuevas, desempeñandose a la vez como gestor de salud. Sin embargo desea tener un negocio propio, por ello planea abir un servicio de venta de computadoras. Es por ello que solicitará 2,000 nuevos soles para la cuota inicial en la compra de una moto para desempeñar su trabajo de manera eficiente, en llevar los pesados productos que venderá.
texts.en:
Emerson is 28 years old. He is single and has no children. He is known for having a great work ethic. He currently lives in a rented house made of high-quality materials. He completed his higher education in accounting; upon finishing his studies, he managed to be taken on by a public health establishment in his area where he has worked for one year and ten months.

He says that he is pleased with his job because he has great coworkers and he has learned many new things since he also performs healthcare administration duties; however, he wants to have his own business, so he is planning to open a computer sales service. To that end, he is requesting 2,000 nuevos soles (PEN) to make the initial payment toward the purchase of a motorcycle so that he can work efficiently and carry the heavy products that he will sell.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for transporting computer products.

loans.name: Deysy Yaneth

texts.es:
Deysy tiene 22 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Aguaytia, ciudad de clima caluroso y de paisajes hermosos y una gastronomía variada.  Ella es madre soltera y lucha cada dia por sacar adelante a su pequeño de 2 años de edad, para Deysy su pequeño hijo es lo más importante que tiene en la vida y por ello le da todo su amor. Ella aprendió a trabajar desde muy joven ya que no tenía muchos recursos económicos y por ello solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar contabilidad.

Cada día Deysy se levanta muy temprano para aperturar su pequeño negocio de costura, ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 9 horas al día y puede atender hasta 5 clientes en el día; ella cree que está saliendo  adelante con su negocio ya que es responsable y cumplida con sus clientes.

Deysy está muy agradecida  con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le están brindando ella podrá comprar un pequeño terreno, ya que ella vive actualmente en una casa alquilada y de esta manera podrá tener una vivienda propia  y poder tener un espacio propio para su negocio y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una profesión a su hijo y estudiar la carrera de contabilidad”.
texts.en:
Deysy, 22, lives in the city of Aguaytia, a city with a hot climate, beautiful scenery and varied cuisine.  She’s a single mother who strives daily to move her little two-year-old son forward.  For Deysy, her little son is the most important thing in her life so she gives him all her love.  She learned to work when still very young since she had few economic resources and was only able to study up to fifth year in secondary school but she would have liked to have studied accounting.

Deysy rises very early every day to open her small sewing shop.  She spends about 9 hours daily at work and can take care of up to 5 customers daily.  She believes she’s getting ahead in her business because she’s responsible and doesn’t disappoint her customers.

Deysy is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they are giving her she will be able to buy a small plot of land because she currently lives in a rented house and this way she’ll be able to have a house of her own and have a space of her own for her business so she can continue striving toward making her greatest dream reality: to provide her son with a profession and for her to study accounting.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Mumbua

texts.en: Mumbua is applying for her subsequent loan after successful repayment of the previous loan. She paid it with few hiccups. She is very grateful for the loan and her business grew tremendously. She has now approached Yehu Microfinance Trust for a loan amounting to KES 20,000, so that she can stock her stall with sacks of maize flour and 20 litre cooking oil.

loans.use: to stock her stall with maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
This is Lilibeth, a 35-year-old resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Roy, her business partner, and is a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lilibeth operates a bakery. Breads and spreads are staples in the usual Filipino cuisine, and are used mostly for breakfast and snacks. The most popular type of bread is the Pandesal, a Filipino version of the Spanish Pan de Sal or salted bread. It is baked during the wee hours of the morning and sold steaming hot to early commuters, students and workers. Her store is located adjacent to her house, and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales everyday.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 35,000 loan to buy raw supplies like flour, sugar, and butter, which she needs to continue production and expand her product inventory. She will also use the money for the maintenance of her oven. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.

Lilibeth dreams that her business will expand even more and hopes to have a good and happy family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for bread ingredients and maintenance of her oven.

loans.name: Xatinapense Group

texts.es:
La señora Cleta De Jesus esta casada, tiene 50 años de edad, ella no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 9 hijos los cuales no estudian, se dedica a la tejeduría, inicio este negocio por iniciativa propia y con el propósito de apoyar a su esposo en los gasto de la familia, hasta ahora lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la albañilería.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de hilos de diversos colores, para incrementar su volumen de produccion de tejidos, en el futuro espera tener un negocio grande y con varios empleados. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio, tejeduría, atención a tienda de consumo y a la crianza de animales.
texts.en:
Cleta de Jesus is 50 years old and married. She did not have the opportunity to go to school, and she has nine children who are not in school. She earns her living weaving. She started this business on her own initiative for the purpose of helping her husband with household expenses. Currently, she has ten years of experience. She has the support of her husband, who works as a construction worker.

They have organized a group and are requesting a loan that will be used to purchase different colored yarns to increase Cleta de Jesus's production of woven fabrics. In the future, she hopes to have a large business with several employees. 

The other members of the group earn their livings by working in commerce, weaving, working in a food store, and raising livestock.

loans.use: to buy yarn

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a 64-year-old married woman. She lives in Msambweni, Kenya with her 65-year-old husband who will likely retire by the end of the year. Her five children, two married daughters ages 25 and 23, and three married sons ages 21, 30, and 33, are her greatest financial supporters.
She earns her living by buying and selling goats, a business she has been doing for the last 25 years.This has enabled her to gain enough experience and get a number of customers. It is a low season now and goats are sold at a cheaper price. She wants to take the advantage and buy many goats and resell them when the season improves. It is for this reason that she has approached Yehu with a loan request of KES 20000.

loans.use: to buy many goats and resell them when the season improves

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie has been a farmer for 20 years. She is already a widow with four children. Three of her children have married while her one child is still studying.

Julie grows rice crops. According to her, she is both father and mother to her children since her spouse has passed away. Julie's situation didn't stop her from dreaming of a better lifestyle and improving her financial stability. Through her perseverance and patience in running her farming business, Julie is able to improve her rice crop production. Julie still wants to have continuous growth of her farming business, so that's the reason why she is asking for additional capital of PHP20,000. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer and insecticide to ensure proper growth of her rice crops to reach its maturity period. She hopes that next crop season, she can gain better yields and secure her family's future and let her youngest child finish her studies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her rice farming business

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga tiene 39 años de edad, es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante a pesar de las adversidades por las cuales ha atravesado, ya que sufrió la pérdida de su esposo hace algunos años, fue algo muy triste porque no solo era su esposo sino su fiel amigo, pasaron muchos días para que pueda sobreponerse pero logro sacar fuerzas y decidió seguir adelante, tal es así que luego de mucho esfuerzo y ahorro logro iniciar su negocio de venta de bebidas gaseosas y cervezas, con el cual puede solventar los gastos de su hogar con mucho esfuerzo, ella atiende en su negocio alrededor de 9 horas al día y puede atender hasta 10 clientes diariamente; ella cree que está saliendo adelante con su negocio porque es amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque tiene mucha fe y tiene un ángel de la guarda que la acompaña en todo el cual es su esposo.

Olga está muy agradecida con el apoyo que le están brindando los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a esta ayuda Olga podrá comprar una congeladora para su negocio ya que actualmente no tienen donde conservar sus productos a una temperatura adecuada, asimismo comprara cervezas al por mayor  para poder abastecer su negocio, así ella mejorara sus ingresos y seguirá luchando por hacer realidad su más grande sueño: “Tener una empresa distribuidora”.
texts.en:
Olga, 39, is a woman who very much wants to get ahead despite the adversities she’s gone through.  She suffered the loss of her husband some years ago; it was something very sad because he wasn’t just her husband but also her true friend.  Many days had to pass before she could overcome this but she managed to find the strength and decided to continue forward so much so that after much effort and saving she managed to start a business selling soft-drinks and beer that with much effort she’s able to cover household expenses with.  She tends to her business for about 9 hours daily and can take care of up to 10 customers per day.  She believes she’s doing well in her business because she’s kind to her customers and above all because she has strong faith and has a guardian angel who is always with her: her husband.

Olga is very grateful for the support Kiva lenders are providing because thanks to this help Olga will be able to buy a freezer because she currently does not have anywhere to  store her products at the proper temperature.  She will also buy beer at wholesale to stock her business so she can improve income and continue striving to  make her greatest dream reality: to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and beer at wholesale.

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan is 63 years old. He lives in the small village of Nigvziani with his wife, who is provided with a retirement pension. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have three milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese products which are sold locally. Besides, Levan grows nuts, maize and potatoes on the family owned land. He sells the harvested products at the local open market. 
Levan is a very hardworking man, with a rich experience in his work. Levan requested a loan for purchasing an additional milk cow and a calf. After purchasing a milk cow, he will be able to receive more milk. With the received milk, his wife will produce more cheese and sell it locally for a good price. The calf will be raised and after several months it will become a dairy cow. Another part of the credit will be used for purchasing feed for cattle. The cows will be fed properly and Levan will get a planned amount of milk.  This will increase the income of the family. With increased income they will be able to improve their living conditions. Levan awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow and calf and feed for them

loans.name: Tareq

texts.en:
Tareq is a 26-year-old guy who recently got married. He works in a governmental entity.

Tareq used to go to cafés with his friends almost on a daily basis where they would enjoy having coffee and smoking a 'hooka' (waterpipe). From there he decided to open his own café to make money rather than spending a lot on his evenings. Having two jobs has allowed Tareq to get married at a young age and he is looking forward to starting his own family.

For that reason, he wants to enhance his café and add a new type of drinks to his menu. That is why he has applied for a youth loan. In the future he also wants to be able to serve food plates beside drinks and 'hooka'.

loans.use: to add a new type of drinks

loans.name: Bulondo A Group

texts.en:
Bulondo A is a group of 10 farmers in Bungoma South District, represented by Mary. The group has 8 women and 2 men. Mary is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of maize, millet and sorghum. Mary first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2010 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Mary joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and gain good training on farming.

Mary described her harvest as excellent last year as a One Acre Fund farmer and hopes for another good year in the 2013 Long Rains season. She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send her children to school and invest in cows. Mary’s group members will each receive input loans for ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive inputs for 5 acres of maize and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 49 years old and married with three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. For over five years, she has owned and operated a retail business in the local community; she earns 20,000 PHP each month. 

Helen joined GDMPC in 2010. She is requesting a loan of 36,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, shampoo, soap, and rice. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, shampoo, soap, and rice.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 63 years old and widowed with five children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. For over 20 years, she has owned and operated a farm, planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living. She earns 3,000 PHP each month. 

Teodora joined GDMPC in 2009. She is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is married with four children, two of whom go to school. She also takes care of her two sisters.

For six years, Christine has run a tailoring business. She sells her products to a variety of people, and she works seven days a week. She also generates additional income from brick-laying. 

Christine has applied for a loan of 1,300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more cloth and thread. Her major business challenges include transportation and electricity. 

Christine hopes to send her children to university and also to own a tailoring school.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and feeding her family.

loans.use: to buy more cloth and thread.

loans.name: Ermalyn

texts.en:
Ermalyn is a 35-year-old married woman with two children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. Ermalyn makes a living through her shop, which she owns and manages in her local village.  She has had the shop for over three years, and makes 10,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) a month.

Ermalyn joined GDMPC in 2011. She is now asking for a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy more products like soap, shampoo, sugar, coffee, rice and canned goods. She plans to use the extra revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell like soap, shampoo, sugar, coffee, rice, and canned goods.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan, age 54, is a rice farmer. She and her husband live in Prey Chor district and have five children, the eldest of whom is grown and married. The other children help Chan to manage the family farm during each growing season. The rice produced on the farm is not only Chan's source of income but is also used for family consumption. Chan's husband is a Khmer traditional musician who is famous for his talent for playing musical instruments. He generates his income by playing music in the province, especially for wedding parties.
 
Due to insufficient funds, Chan is requesting a loan through HKL in order to prepare for the wedding party of her second child. This loan amount will help her to cover the food costs that will be incurred during the wedding ceremony. 

A portion of the loan funds will also be used to buy a trailer for loading goods.

loans.use: to cover the food costs that will be incurred during the wedding ceremony of her second-eldest child

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
This is Herminia. She previously accessed a 25,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 30,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her in covering their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Herminia dreams of having more businesses that will all grow and expand. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her life and business and she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Talal

texts.en:
With his previous loan, Talal was able to pay for the first semester of his second year of school. Talal has recently started working after school to be able to help his family, since there are six brothers and one sister.  

Talal is applying for another loan to continue with his studies and pay for his next semester of studying finance.

loans.use: to pay for his next semester of school.

loans.name: Ma. Aida

texts.en: Ma.Aida is a 54-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has four grown children. She engages in coconut wine vending. Aside from coconut wine vending, she also engages in buying and  selling fruit and vegetables. She has been in both businesses for five years. She requested a loan of  4,000 PHP to acquire more capital to purchase more fruit and vegetables to sell. In the future, Ma.Aida would like to expand her business to have a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to acquire more capital to purchase more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Joven

texts.en:
Joven is a 58-year-old married man with four children, living in Clarin in Misamis Occidental. He owns and manages some farmland for a living, planting and harvesting corn to sell. He's managed the land for five years now, and he earns around 8,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) a month. 

Joven joined GDMPC in 2010, and he is now asking for a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy fertilizer such as manure. He plans to use the extra revenue generated to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Khawla

texts.en:
Khawla is a 56-year-old divorced woman with a handicap.  Despite the difficulties she faces, she has managed to grow her tailoring business that she runs to make a living.  

Khawla is asking for a new loan to grow her production and make extra clothes to sell, rather than just making what people have ordered.  To do this, she needs to buy some new threads and material.

loans.use: To buy more threads and material.

loans.name: Ma. Lourdes

texts.en:
Margaret Lourdes, age 35, is a fish vendor. Her husband is a fisherman. They live in Talibon, Bohol, and have three children, ages five, six, and nine. 

Margaret Lourdes is requesting a loan in order to buy nets for fishing and buckets for storage, as well as to pay for essential repairs to the house where the family lives. 

In the future, Margaret Lourdes hopes to expand her business and to save enough money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy nets for fishing and buckets for storage, as well as to pay for essential repairs to the family home

loans.name: Mkulima Group

texts.en:
Mkulima is a group of 10 farmers in Bungoma South District represented by Getrude. The group has 8 women and 2 men. Getrude is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ an acre of maize, millet and sorghum will be delivered to her on credit. Getrude is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season. She joined One Acre Fund in order to use her increased profits to send her children to school and learn good farming techniques.

Last year, Getrude harvested 4 bags of maize on 1 acre of land. She is excited to improve her harvest as a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. She plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school and save for the future. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Getrude’s group will receive 5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina, age 51, operates a retail store business to earn an income. She and her husband have four children, three of whom are still in school. The eldest is grown and has a job. Rizalina works hard to support her family.

Rizalina would like to expand her retail store through the purchase of larger volumes of canned goods, instant noodles, shampoo, sugar, cooking oil, and eggs. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 5,000. She is confident that these loan funds will allow her to provide quality service and to better satisfy customer demand. 

Rizalina hopes and prays that her retail store will continue to improve so that she can sustain the family's basic needs and eventually send her children on to higher levels of education.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, instant noodles, shampoo, sugar, cooking oil, and eggs to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Mkulima Group

texts.en:
Evans is a member of Mkulima Group in Bungoma South District. He is pictured with 13 One Acre Fund farmers. The group is made up of 11 women and two men. Evans is standing on the right with his hand raised. 

Evans will be receiving an input loan for a half acre of maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation. The 2013 Long Rains season will be Evans’s first season with One Acre Fund. He joined this year in order to grow enough food for the family and to develop better farming skills.

Evans reports that his harvest last year was poor. He is hopeful that he will have an excellent harvest as a One Acre Fund farmer. He intends to use his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season to send his children to school as well as to invest in poultry. 

Evans’s group members will each receive input loans for half an acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total, they will receive inputs for six acres of maize and sorghum.

(Carolyne, a member of Mkulima Group, is pictured above. However, her husband has already appeared on Kiva and she shares her OAF membership with him. In order to prevent the double funding of a farmer, she is pictured as a member of the group, but will not receive funding from this loan.)

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy kerosene to offer for sale

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad, age 21, is a university student. He is the youngest of three siblings. Ahmad is majoring in environmental and water engineering at university. 

Ahmad is applying for an educational loan to help him pay the fees for his next semester.

loans.use: to help him pay college fees for his next semester at university

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan, age 50, sells hardware products. He has been engaged in this business for 30 years and started his own business in 1997. Over the years, he has gained a great deal of customer loyalty and trust. Hassan and his wife have four children.
 
Hassan is a hard worker. He is well known in his region for his high-quality products and good prices.

He is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to increase his merchandise with special items that are made in Turkey. These are items that are in high demand in the market.
 
Hassan hopes to keep on meeting his customers' needs and expanding his workplace as much as he can so that he can provide his family with a good living. He works hard to offer his family the best living standards that he possibly can.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise with special items that are made in Turkey

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a fourth-year university student. He is majoring in civil engineering. 

Mohammad has five siblings who are being supported by his parents, so he needs to be able to support his educational costs on his own. He has therefore applied for this loan in order to be able to pay college fees for the upcoming semester.

loans.use: to pay college fees for the upcoming semester at university

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en: Gorret is married with three children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a drug shop business and has been in this business for 10 years selling to all categories of people but on a retail basis only. She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of syrups and tablets. She generates additional income from rental rooms. She works in a shop that she rents and works seven days a week. Her major business challenge includes seasonality and defaulters.  She aspires to own a fully stocked drug shop and also to build more rental rooms. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent for her business, and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of syrups and tablets

loans.name: Rozan

texts.en: Rozan is a 23-year-old single lady. She has three brothers and three sisters. Rozan is a university student majoring in mathematics. She is applying for an educational loan in order to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Marthes

texts.fr: Marthes est une femme mariée.Elle exerce un commerce de tissus et d'articles de mercerie.Elle parvient à générer des revenus qui lui permettent de subvenir à ses propres besoins ainsi qu'à ceux de ses enfants.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un pret de 250 000f pour acheter des garnitures de tissus.
texts.en: Marthes is a married woman and a merchant of fabrics and fabric notions. She is able to earn income that allows her to meet her needs as well as those of her children. In order to expand her business, Marthes is seeking a loan of 250,000 XOF to purchase fabric linings.

loans.use: to purchase fabric linings and notions

loans.name: Motasem

texts.en: Motasem is a 22-year-old single guy. He is one of  six brothers in the family. Motasem is a university student studying crime analysis. He also works in a café to support himself and pay  his expenses. Now Motasem is applying for an educational loan in order to pay his next semester fees.

loans.use: to pay his next semester fees

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en:
Bakari, from Msambweni, Kenya, is 43 years old and lives with his wife and children. They have three boys and four girls, all of whom are still in school.

Bakari is a hard working business person with great ambition to improve his family's standard of living. For more than two years, he has operated a grocery store, where he sells items such as onions, tomatoes, cabbage, and bananas. He has gained excellent sales experience, which has increased the number of customers that visit his store and improved his income. His grocery is located in a local trading center, where there is a major market for his goods. Bakari has many regular customers that prefer to shop in his grocery because he always has the products they need at affordable prices, and he provides good service.

Bakari is very dedicated to his work. He is energetic, and he has many goals for the future.

Bakari has requestion a loan of 20,000 KES to buy sacks of potatoes and carrots.

loans.use: to buy sacks of potatoes and carrots.

loans.name: Kawthar

texts.en:
Kawthar is a 33-year-old mother of three sons. She has a tailoring business at home that helps pay some of the household bills. 

Kawthar wants to increase her production, so she has applied for this loan to buy more fabric and thread.

loans.use: to buy more fabric and thread.

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.en:
Rafaela is a 64-year-old married woman with three children, living in Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She owns and manages a fishing business, and sells fish in the local village to make a living.  Rafaela has run her business for over ten years, and makes around 7,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) a month. 

Rafaela joined GDMPC in 2009, and she is now asking for a loan of 10,500 PHP to buy fishing equipment such as hooks and nets.  She plans to use the extra revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment such as hooks and nets.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 61-year-old married woman with 5 children, living in Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She owns and manages farm land for a living, planting and harvesting bananas for sale in the local village. Evelyn has managed her business for over 5 years. 

Evelyn joined GDMPC in 2010, and is now asking for a loan of 10,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the extra revenue generated by the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en:
This is Cleofe. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Cleofe dreams that all her children will have a good life and that she will have good health and a strong body for her children. She hopes that her business will continue to expand and become more stable. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. Afellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
Suleiman is 28 years old and a married man with two children. He lives with his  children and their mother whom he married twelve years ago in Msambweni, Kenya. Both his children, aged twelve and nine, are in school. 

He is a very hard-working person and is always acts as a good example to many in his home town of Msambweni. He owns a grocery shop that he has been operating for the last year where he is selling watermelons, oranges, bananas, onions, tomatoes and potatoes. For the last three months his business has been growing rapidly and therefore to satisfy his customers, Suleiman has made  a loan request amounting to ksh.30,000 so to expand his shop and stock it with enough potatoes, onions, tomatoes and buy watermelons as this in turn will help improve his  income range.

loans.use: to expand his shop and stock it with enough potatoes, onions, and tomatoes and buy watermelons

loans.name: Diockel

texts.fr: Diockel est un homme marié. Il est père de quatre enfants.Il pratique l'agriculture depuis plusieurs années. En même temps, il mène une activité d'embouche bovine qui lui permet d'augmenter ses revenus.Il sollicite un pret de 300 000f pour acheter deux boeufs. Son ambition est de construire une ferme d'élevage.
texts.en: Diockel is a married man. He is the father of four children and has been a farmer for several years. As an additional source of income, Diockel also has a business raising and fattening cattle for resale. He is currently seeking a loan of 250,000 XOF to purchase two steers. Diockel's ambition is to build a cattle breeding farm.

loans.use: to purchase two steers.

loans.name: Michel

texts.fr: Michel est un homme marié, père de cinq enfants.Il Exerce l'activité d'agriculture depuis plusieurs années.En saison sèche, il pratique l'activité de maraîchage pour renforcer ses revenus. Cette activité d'agriculture lui permet de de subvenir à ses besoins  et de prendre en charge les dépenses d'entretien de sa famille.Il sollicite ainsi un pret de 250000f pour acheter des semences d'oignons.Il ambitionne d'étendre l'exploitation de ses terres.
texts.en: Michel is a married father of five children. He has been in the agriculture business for several years. In the dry season, Michel grows produce to sell in the market to enhance his earnings. This business allows him to provide for his needs as well as those of his family. Michel is seeking a loan of 250,000 XOF to purchase onion seeds. Michel's aim is to expand the amount of usable farmland on his property.

loans.use: to purchase onion seeds.

loans.name: Yima Group

texts.en:
Yima Group is located in Bungoma South District. It is a group of eight women and five men and it is led by Juliana, who is pictured on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for a half acre of maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Juliana is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season. She joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and to gain better skills in farming.

Juliana managed to harvest three bags of maize on half an acre of land last year. As a One Acre Fund farmer, she hopes to harvest even more. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and to purchase more land. 

For the 2013 Long Rains season, Juliana’s group members will take input loans for a half acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on six and a half acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum

loans.name: Rasha

texts.en:
Rasha, age 34, is a homemaker. She has recently given birth to a baby daughter. She would like to help her husband support the family, so she decided to start a clothing sales business, which she operates from her home. Her goal is to generate some income to help improve the family's living conditions. 

At present, Rasha buys and sells used clothing, but she would like to expand her business by offering new clothing items as well.

Rasha is applying for a youth loan to add new clothes to her offerings. She hopes to increase her profits in this way.

loans.use: to buy new clothing items to offer for sale

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en: Sawsan is a 56-year-old housewife; she has a son staying with her. Sawsan has a small tailoring workshop at her house where she mostly makes curtains. Now she is applying for a loan to buy more fabric and thread and start making clothing pieces beside curtains to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy more fabric and thread

loans.name: Juan Alfredo

texts.es:
El señor Juan Alfredo esta casado, tiene 37 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educación primaria, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales están estudiando 2, se dedica a la tejeduría de cortes típicos y otros tejidos, inicio este trabajo siendo operario, hasta el momento lleva 4 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien  se dedica al mismo trabajo.

Solicita un prestamos que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos labores de diferente diseños para la elaboración de diferente cortes, con varios colores y diseños; espera en el futuro tener un negocio grande y reconocido, quiere mejorar la condición de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Alfredo is 37 years old and married. He completed 6 years of primary education and has 3 children, 2 of whom are in school now. He works in the business of weaving cortes [traditional skirts] and other fabrics. He started this job as a labourer and now has 4 years of experience. He has the support of wife, who works in the same trade.

He is asking for a loan to buy thread and patterns with different designs, to make different cortes in a variety of colours and designs. 

In the future he hopes to have a large and well-known business, and he wants to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies for weaving.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 50 years old and widowed with three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. For over ten years, she has owned and managed a business selling a local coconut leaf dish to earn a living; she earns 1,800 PHP every month. 

Perla joined GDMPC in 2010, and she is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase raw materials needed to make her food products. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make food products for sale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 41-year-old woman who is married with six children.  She lives in Clarin, in Misamis Occidental.  She runs a retail business selling phone accessories, which she has owned and managed for over five years.  Jane makes about 5,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) a month.  

Jane joined GDMPC in 2007, and is now asking for a loan of 9,500 PHP to buy additional accessories. She plans to use the extra revenues generated by the loan to secure a better future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional phone accessories to resell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 23-year-old single guy who has 7 sisters and a younger brother. Mohammad is a university student who is majoring in accounting. He is applying for this educational loan to pay his upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en: Haruna, 41 years old, operates a poultry farm; He began this business because he wanted to raise money to meet basic needs for his family. He has four children and all of them attend school. His main challenges include bad debtors, high price fluctuations and competition in his village. He would like to expand his business to get more income to support his children and meet their school fee requirements. In the picture is Haruna and his wife in the poultry house. (She signed the waiver form.)

loans.use: to buy baby chicks

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is married, with three children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of her grandmother. She has a beauty salon and has been in this business for ten years and works in a shop that she rents.  

She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy more boxes of cosmetics, weaves, braids, and hair relaxers. She works in a shop that she rents and works seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include transportation and off-and-on electricity. 

She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees, and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of hair relaxers, braids, weaves, and cosmetics for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Enos

texts.en: Facing prolonged droughts and poor soil in the area where Enos lived, he kept moving from place to place to look for water for his animals. With a little income from sales of milk, he dug a dam from which rain water collects during rainy seasons and can be preserved to be used through the drought. This saved him and family from moving from place to place and long distances in search of water. He now buys cows that he feeds well and sells them off after a period of three to six months. He has managed to meet his family needs, pay tuition for his children and buy supplies. This loan will help him to buy more cows, boosting his cattle-fattening business. Enos strongly believes he will able to pay back the loan and still make a profit.

loans.use: To buy more cows for fattening

loans.name: Las Entusiastas De La 3Ra Etapa De La Era Group

texts.es: Este es el Grupo “Las Entusiastas de la 3ra Etapa de la Era” que conforman 05 socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio que pasan al ciclo 06. Dina tiene 52 años, casada con 04 hijos. Dina se dedica a la venta de comida y cuenta con clientes fidelizados. Dina ha solicitado el préstamo para la compra de aceite, arroz, azúcar, gaseosa. Una de las metas de Dina es ampliar más su negocio y así poder atender mejor a sus clientes. Dina está muy contenta con este préstamo y agradece a Kiva. Dina se encuentra ubicada en la parte de adelante es la primera del lado derecho, viste polo morado. El señor Juan aparece en la foto pequeña al lado superior derecho.
texts.en:
This is the group "Las Entusiastas de la 3ra Etapa de la Era" ["Enthusiasts of the the 3rd Stage of the Era"] which is made up of 5 members who work in a variety of business activities. This is their 6th loan together.

Dina is 52 years old and is married with 4 children. She works selling food and has loyal customers. She applied for this loan to buy oil, rice, sugar and soda pop. One of her goals is to expand her business and, in doing so, to be able to serve her customers better. She is very happy with this loan and thanks Kiva for it. 

Dina is the first person on the right side at the front, wearing a purple shirt. Juan is in the small photo in the upper righthand corner.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, sugar and soda pop.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 25-year-old married man with two children, living in Gaza in Palestine.  He owns and manages a retail business selling car accessories, and employs one other person in the shop. 

Mohammad has asked for this youth loan so that he can buy some used furniture and some additional stocks for his shop. He hopes that the loan will help him to increase his sales, and improve the income that he makes from the shop.

loans.use: to buy some used furniture and additional stocks for his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install a display window for his shop as well as to increase his inventory

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha, age 45, is a conservative woman, so she asked her son Ahmad to take her place in the photo. She is the mother of six children.

Ahmad is majoring in accounting at college. Aisha has applied for this loan in order to pay for her son's college fees for the upcoming semester. She would like to see him complete his studies and to obtain a good job upon graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her son's college fees for the upcoming semester

loans.name: Esma

texts.en: Esma is 42 years old. She lives in the small village of Kobuleti district with her husband Nugzar and two children. Her husband has a tractor and gets some income while serving local people. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of land, where maize, potatoes and mandarin trees are grown. Esma sells the harvested products locally. Esma and Nugzar work hard to insure a good harvest and they have rich experience in their business. Esma requested a loan for purchasing a milk cow and to build a shed. She plans to produce dairy products and sell them at the local open market. This will increase their income and Esma will be able to improve the living conditions of her children. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow and to build a shed.

loans.name: Asaad

texts.en:
Asaad is a 25-year-old single Lebanese man. He has been working in a special hardware and construction needs business since 2010. He sells special painting tools and supplies in addition to sanitary, electricity and construction supplies. 
Asaad is a hard worker. He is planning to expand his business by applying for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. This loan will help him buy his products from other sources so he can get special prices and offers.
His business is highly requested in his region. He is the only one with such items to sell, and his region has much construction work to support such a business.
At first, he had problems because he didn't know the market's needs. Today, he has become an expert and he knows exactly what the market needs and requests.
He hopes to start a wholesale trade as soon as possible to cover other requests in the region.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise with special requested products

loans.name: Hafez

texts.en:
Hafez is a 42-year-old married man and father of three children. He has been working in the construction business for 23 years. In 1990, he started his own business to improve his family's living conditions and increase his income. Hafez is a Palestinian refugee who is working hard to move his family out of the camp they are living in, seeking a better life and future.
Hafez is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, to increase his supply of business tools by adding newly ones to make sure he is responding well to customer needs.
His work is mobile depending on a project's location. He is looking forward to opening a general contracting company.

loans.use: To increase his business tools and machines

loans.name: Gertrude Group

texts.en:
Gertrude is a 55-year-old single mother, with grown-up children.  She is the leader of "Gertrude's Group", the other member of which is Gifty who is also shown above.  They have been borrowing together for six months.  Both ladies make their living by reselling wax-printed cloth, and baking bread for sale.  

This is Gertrude's second loan with Kiva, and her sixth loan with ID-Ghana, who is Kiva's partner.  Gertrude's first Kiva loan was for 1,400 Ghanaian Cedis (GHS), which she finished repaying with no problems. She is now asking for GHS 2,000 which she is going to use to buy wax-printed cloth to sell to her customers. Her group is asking for a total loan of GHS 3,000 to expand their businesses.

Gertrude has reinvested her profits that she managed to make with her previous loans, so her capital base has increased.  She is also saving with ID-Ghana so she has back-up capital.

loans.use: To buy more wax-print and supply to customers.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en: Hala is a 22-year-old single lady. She has five brothers and one sister. Hala is a university student majoring in business administration. She is trying her best to graduate as soon as possible with her bachelor's degree and start looking for a job where she can get actual experience. Hala is applying for another educational loan to pay for her upcoming semester fess.

loans.use: to pay for her next semester fees.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has operated a restaurant business in her home for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week and sells at both retail and wholesale levels.  She generates additional income through selling charcoal. Her major business challenges include transportation and defaulters.

Mary and her husband have three children, all of whom attend school. She also supports additional family members (her late sisters’ children). The family resides in a rented house. They have access to electricity but not to piped water. Mary's major expenditures are school fees and rent.

Mary has applied for a loan in the amount of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO, which she will use to buy beef, fresh peas, ground nuts, bunches of green bananas, and Irish potatoes. 

Her goal is someday to own a fully-stocked restaurant and also to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy beef, fresh peas, ground nuts, bunches of green bananas, and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Basma

texts.en: Basma, a 30-year-old single lady, is one of five brothers and sisters. In order to help the family finances, Basma works at home in the embroidery business. She is applying today for this youth loan to buy some material for that business.

loans.use: to buy some material for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar, age 20 and unmarried, is a university student. He also works in a medium-sized market, where he sells such items as food products and cleaning products. 

Omar took out a previous loan to cover his educational fees, but now he is applying for this youth loan to replenish his store inventory and to add a selection of new types of food products.

loans.use: to replenish his store inventory and to add a selection of new types of food products

loans.name: Bulondo D Group

texts.en:
Joan’s group is called "Bulondo D" and has ten farmers, one man and nine women. They live in Bungoma South District in Kenya. Joan is pictured on the right of the group with her hand raised. She will receive a loan to purchase inputs for her farm, sufficient to plant half an acre with sorghum, millet, and maize. 

Joan joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains of 2006, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. She joined so that she could access the best input prices, and the best training on farming.  She reports that before joining One Acre Fund, she was able to grow about one bag of maize on each half acre, but with her One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012 season, she managed to harvest four bags per half acre! She plans to use future profits from the harvest to send her children to school, and to invest in cows. 

During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive half-an-acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Joan’s group will receive a total of 5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seed and fertilizer to grow maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Mellen

texts.en:
Mellen is 35 years old, and is married to Godfrey who is a business man. They are blessed with three school-going children. Mellen manages a poultry farm as her primary business, and offers catering services as her secondary business.  She has been running these businesses for the past three years with a monthly income of 80,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES), which she uses to support her family. 

This is Mellen's first loan with KADET LTD, after learning about KADET LTD from a KADET staff member. She will use the loan to buy chicks and poultry food. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will save to buy a car for transporting cakes and poultry eggs for sale. Mellen has hoped and dreamed of having a car for her businesses for a long time.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry food.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a cattle farmer. He reports that illiteracy has been his biggest problem in life but that it has not deterred him from becoming a good farmer. Through hard work, he has been able to sustain his family's needs, and, most importantly, he has been able to pay tuition fees for his children. Ensuring his children's education is something he believes will lighten his older years. 

He has applied for a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 Uganda shillings, which he will use to boost his cattle-raising business. He is a hard-working, resilient, and innovative man.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Hentry

texts.en:
Hentry, age 54, runs a restaurant and hotel business. His establishment offers accommodation and provides meals that include tamales, eggs, beans, soups, meat dishes, and salads. Hentry has been running this business for a number of years and has gained a good deal of sales experience, which has allowed him to make bigger profits and expand his customer base. He is now well-known throughout the region for preparing the most delicious dishes in the area and for offering affordable accommodation. He tells us that the secret to his success is hard work and love of the job.

Hentry and his wife have 12 children and live in Msambweni, Kenya. Ten of their children are still attending school. The two eldest have finished their schooling and are now looking for work. Hentry's greatest expenditure is the paying of school fees.

He is been a member for quite a long time now and has repaid his previous loans. He has approached us with a loan request amounting to Ksh. 20,000, which he will use to buy new hotel utensils and to purchase sugar, coffee, and rice for the restaurant.

loans.use: to buy new hotel utensils and to purchase sugar, coffee, and rice for the restaurant

loans.name: Good Family Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present the members of the “Good Family” group. This group is composed of two small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 2,000,000 Leones for each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Margrete is the leader of this group. She is 37 years old, and married to a police officer; the couple has three children. Margrete sells clothes, and has been running this business for many years. 

With her share of this loan, she is going to buy a large quantity of clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of clothes to add to her current stock

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is 36 years old. She lives in the Gori District with her aunt and six year old daughter. Nana has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, without success. Her loan request was rejected each time, due to low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Nana works a nurse at local private clinic. In addition, she is a part-time music teacher at a local school. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Nana has requested loan from Credo to start up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program has a provision for business start-up and re-startup with credits with for soft conditions to the country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Nana will sell cheese products. She will purchase cheese products from wholesalers, and will resell at a higher price. With another part of the credit she plans to sell laundry soap. 

Nana is a very hard working woman, and she will do her best to increase the income of her family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to start a business selling cheese products and laundry soap.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel, de 27 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy trabajadora, es divorciada y tiene 02 hijos de 10 y 03 años. Juntos habitan en su casa propia. El trabajo de Isabel consiste en la venta de comida durante el fin de semana, los sábados y domingos sale a la vereda de su casa y alista su parrilla, condimenta sus pollos y se pone a asar en espera de los comensales; mientras que de lunes a viernes trabaja en una fuente de soda. Lleva este ritmo de trabajo por mas de cinco años, siendo la venta de parrilla hace algunos meses. Al principio le fue un poco complicado, pero con el pasar del tiempo pudo agarrar el ritmo y ahora no tiene temor de salir a vender.
Le gusta mucho realizar su trabajo, tiene tiempo para poder brindar a sus hijos, además tiene buenos ingresos, ya que como menciona tiene dos actividades y le genera doble ingreso. Tiene muchos planes en mente, le gustaría tener un negocio propio, pero por ahora solo desea poner su fuente de soda y así no depender de nadie para poder generar sus ingresos. Por el momento esta decidida a criar pollos ya que no tendría que comprar de otro lugar y le saldría mas cómodo, es por ello que solicita su primer crédito con MFP, y espera de su colaboración para continuar son sus objetivos. 
Con el monto solicitado 800 soles, comprará pollos para criar en su casa, además de algunos ingredientes e insumos para seguir con su crianza.
texts.en:
Isabel, 27 years old, is a good, amiable, and hard-working woman. She is divorced and has 2 children, ages 10 and 3. They live together in her house. Isabel's work consists in selling meals on weekends. On Saturdays and Sundays, she heads out along the path to prepare her grille, seasons her chicken, and begins to grille it, awaiting her customers. Then, Monday through Friday, she works at a soda fountain. She has kept up this rhythm of work for more than 5 years, having added the grilled chicken sales some months ago. At the outset, this proved a little complicated for Isabel, but with the passage of time, she came to master the rhythm and, now, she has no fear of going out to sell.
 
Isabel enjoys her work very much. She has time for her children and, besides, has a good income, since, as noted, she has 2 activities, thus doubling her income. Isabel has lots of plans in mind; she would like to have her own business, but for now, she just wishes to install a soda fountain and thus, no longer depend on anyone else to generate her income. For the moment, she has decided to raise chickens, so she won't have to buy them somewhere else.  This would be more convenient. That's why Isabel is soliciting her 1st loan through MFP, and she hope the collaboration will continue in the future as she works towards her objectives.

With the borrowed 800 sols, Isabel will purchase chicks to raise in her house, plus buy the necessary feed and other inputs, enabling her to continue raising chickens.

loans.use: to buy chickens to raise plus the necessary supplies, including chicken feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more spare parts for his business and to pay school fees for his child

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim, age 36, operates an auto repair shop business. He repairs motorcycles, replaces broken parts in vehicles, and sells spare parts. He completed his training three years ago and has been engaged in this venture ever since. He has gained good sales experience and his business has helped increase him to gain customers and improve his income. 

Salim lives in Msambweni, Kenya, with his wife and their six children.
 
Salim has expanded his services and now needs to improve his business in order to keep up with demand. He has requested a loan amounting to Ksh. 30,000, which will allow him to build a better stall for his business and to buy spare parts at wholesale prices to stock the stall. He is confident that this investment will increase his profit margin.

He is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to build a better stall for his business and to buy spare parts at wholesale prices to stock the stall

loans.name: Wakulima Group

texts.en:
Josephine is the leader of the Wakulima Group. She is pictured on the right with her hand raised among her fellow group members. The group consists of 10 women, all of whom are farmers in Bungoma South District. 

Farming inputs will be delivered to Josephine on credit, consisting of the necessary materials to plant half an acre of maize, millet, and sorghum. Josephine joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. She joined One Acre Fund so that she could gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and grow enough food for her family.

Josephine reports that before One Acre Fund, she was able to grow about seven bags of maize per half acre, but with her One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, she harvested 12 bags per half acre. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and to save for the future. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Josephine’s group members will take input loans of half an acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on five acres of land.

(Roselyne, a member of Wakulima Group, is pictured above. However, her husband has already appeared on Kiva and she shares her OAF membership with him. In order to prevent the double funding of a farmer, she is pictured as a member of the group, but will not receive funding from this loan.)

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum

loans.name: Wesakulila Group

texts.en:
Protus is a member of Wesakulila Group in Bungoma South District. He is pictured with 12 One Acre Fund farmers. The group consists of nine women and three men. Protus is standing on the right with his hand raised. 

Protus is receiving an input loan for half an acre of maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Protus first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2009 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access the best input prices and to be educated in good farming techniques.

Protus described his harvest as excellent last year as a One Acre Fund farmer, and he hopes for another good year in the 2013 Long Rains season. He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and to repair his home. 

For the 2013 Long Rains season, Protus’s group members will take input loans of half an acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on six acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia, de 30 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Antonio, su esposo, ambos tienen 2 hijos: Stefany y José a los que cuida en su casa propia.
Junto a su esposo, comenzaron a dedicar su tiempo y esfuerzo en la agricultura, en los terrenos que heredó su esposo, comenzaron a sembrar maíz, zapallo y papa. Los cuales siembra con mucha dedicación y esfuerzo, en temporadas de siembra, aprovechan todo lo que puedan, ya que saben que sus esfuerzos serán recompensados, pues cuanto mejor calidad obtengan sus alimentos, más ganancias tendrán. De la misma manera se dedica a la crianza de animales como vacas, cerdos y ovejas, las que engorda para luego venderlas a los carniceros que la visitan constantemente. Con la leche que producen las vacas que posee, realiza un promedio de 10 moldes de queso al día, los cuales vende a los pobladores del mismo lugar, quien son conocedores de lo rico que prepara. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, agradece la oportunidad que le brindan, ya que podrá mejorar su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Julia, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de abono orgánico para su próxima siembra; pues piensa sembrar en un extensión de terreno superior.
texts.en:
Julia is 30 years old and is a hard-working lady. She lives with her husband Antonio and together they have two children, Stefany and José. Julia looks after the children at home.
Together with her husband, Julia started investing time and effort in farming some land her husband inherited. They plant maize, squash and potatoes and show great dedication in tending to their crops. At planting time they work as hard as they can because they know their efforts will be rewarded - the higher the quality of their produce, the higher their earnings will be. Julia also raises livestock including cattle, pigs and sheep, which she fattens up to sell to the butchers who visit frequently. Using the milk from her cows, she makes an average of ten cheeses a day. She sells these to the local people who know how tasty her products are. She belongs to the “Sarita colonia” solidarity group and this is her first loan with MFP. She is grateful for the opportunities they offer her to improve her business. She promises to pay her instalments on time as she likes working within the group and the members are all responsible, dependable people.
Julia will invest the money she is requesting in the purchase of organic fertilizer for the next planting season as she intends to plant her crops over a larger area.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for the next planting season

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en:
Bakari, age 59, is an auto mechanic. He repairs motorcycles and bicycles and has been engaged in this venture for the past 15 years. He has gained a good deal of experience over the years. 

Bakari lives with his wife and children in Msambweni, Kenya. Five of his seven children are still attending school, and his largest ongoing expenditure is the payment of their school fees.

He is requesting a loan amounting to Ksh. 25,000, which he will use to buy spare parts, tools, and equipment. This investment will enable him to service his customers better. With the expected new profit, he will expand his business.

loans.use: o buy spare parts, tools, and equipment for his auto repair business

loans.name: Deniss

texts.es:
Deniss, de 22 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo Aldo y su hijo Jean Franco a quien cuida en la casa que alquiló desde hace 4 años, ahi abrió una tienda de comestibles en la parte superior de la casa, ubicada en una zona céntrica de la ciudad. Comenta que la va muy bien en su trabajo; “Con las ganancias que percibo diariamente, puedo alimentar a mis hijos”, afirma. Mientra que su esposo trabaja en una panadería, y con su ganancia ahorran y cubren algunos gastos extras. Dentro de poco empezaran las clases por lo que desea comprar útiles de escritorio como lapiceros, cuadernos y demás para poder vender, es por ese motivo que necesita de un capital de trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “niño Jesús” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP. Agradece la oportunidad de progreso, prometiendo ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Además gusta de pertenecer a su asociación, donde todos son unidos y solidarios.
Deniss, invertirá el dinero en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para su tienda de comestibles, además de articulos para la etapa escolar.
texts.en:
Deniss is a natural 22 year old woman. She lives in the company of her husband Aldo and her son Jean Franco who she takes care of in the house she's rented for 4 years. She opened a grocery store 4 years ago in the front of this house, which is in a central area of the city. 

Deniss says her work is going very well, since her home is the only one. "With the daily earnings I receive, I can feed my children," she affirms. Meanwhile her husband works in a bakery, and with his earnings they save and cover some of the extra expenses. 

Soon classes will start, so Deniss wants to buy office supplies like pens, notebooks, and other things, which is why she needs working capital. 

Deniss belongs to the Baby Jesus communal bank, and this is her second loan with MFP. She welcomes the opportunity to progress, promising to be punctual with her payments. She also likes belonging to an assocation where everyone is united in solidarity. 

Deniss will invest her money in the purchase of staple foods for her grocery store, as well as school supplies.

loans.use: to purchase items for her grocery store as well as school supplies

loans.name: Noonkokwa

texts.en:
Noonkokwa, age 37, is a milk vendor. She sells her wares at the local community center. She has been engaged in this business for the past five years and earns a monthly income of KES. 20,000. She and her husband Dominic have seven children. 

Noonkokwa is taking out her third loan with KADET Ltd. She will use her loan funds to purchase a larger stock of milk. She will do this by buying more Jeri cans of milk on a daily basis.

She will use the anticipated profit to open another business, which she believes will enable her to generate enough income to better support the family. Her goal is to provide her family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more Jeri cans of milk to offer for sale

loans.name: Rodulfo

texts.en:
Rodulfo is 42 years old and married with four children. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a business selling food products in the local community; he earns 15,000 PHP each month. 

Rodulfo joined GDMPC in 2010, and he is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional beverages and meats, such as pork, chicken, and beef, for sale. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional meat and beverages for sale.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha runs a food stall business. She has requested another Kiva loan in the amount of Ksh 50,000 to boost her business. With the loan funds, she will purchase tomatoes, wheat flour, onions, chicken, and rice. 

She is grateful of Kiva lenders for the support.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, peppers, onions, chicken, and rice

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 52 years old and married with two children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. For over seven years, she has owned and operated a retail business in the local community to earn a living; she earns 2,000 PHP each month. 

Cecilia joined GDMPC in 2009, and now she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like shampoo, soap, rice, coffee, sugar, and canned goods. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Reneboy

texts.en:
Reneboy is 31 years old and married with one child. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. For over three years, he has worked for a family member's business providing motor transport services; he earns 10,000 PHP each month. 

Reneboy joined GDMPC in 2010. He is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to repair an existing vehicle for better service. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy de 41 años esta casada con Víctor de 38 años, junto a él ha logrado formar una familia sólida con 3 hijos. 
Residen actualmente en una vivienda construida a base de madera que construyeron de a pocos.
Se desempeña actualmente como productora de cacao y café orgánico, y esto gracias a unas parcelas que obtuvo a un precio bajo ha logrado con el paso de los años sacar adelante a su familia y consolidar su economía familiar con la venta de granos de cacao.
