A manera de hallar un progreso en su economía, ha pensado aperturar una tienda de abarrotes para así aumentar sus ingresos, siendo una ventaja además por no haber otro en alrededores. Es por ello que gracias a un ambiente habilitado en su domicilio desea construir el local de su futuro negocio con maderas. Es por ello que requiere 1000 soles para comprar madera y contratar aun maestro en carpintería.
texts.en:
Nancy is 41 years old and married to Victor, 38. Together they have set-up a solid family with three children. At the moment they live in a home constructed from a base of wood, which they built gradually. 

Currently Nancy works as a cacao and organic coffee producer, and this is thanks to some land that she obtained for a low price. As the years have gone by she has managed to take her family forward and consolidate her family finances by selling cacao beans. 

Because of making financial progress, she has thought about opening a grocery store to increase her income, a further advantage being that there is no other grocery store in the nearby area. It's for this, that thanks to a prepared area in her home she wants to construct the premises of her future business with wood and requires 1000 soles to buy wood and hire a carpentry teacher.

loans.use: to buy wood and employ a carpenter

loans.name: Anong

texts.en:
Anong is a model of perseverance and good humor. Although she has seen the difficult side of life up close, she continues to keep her spirits high and to believe that brighter days are ahead. 

Anong is a mother, wife and member of the close-knit Mlabri tribe in rural northern Thailand. Although she now lives in the Ban Boonyuen Village with many of her fellow Mlabri, she spent years without stability. Like many of her fellow Mlabri, Anong was forced into indentured servitude as a field laborer working in slash & burn agriculture. She and her family worked in back-breaking toxic farming in order to pay off a never-ending cycle of debt to stronger clans.

For Anong and the rest of the Mlabri, the past decades have been full of heartbreak, tragedy and incredible perseverance. The gentle Mlabri once lived a peaceful lifestyle as migrant hunter & gatherers, but the teak deforestation and guerrilla warfare of the late 20th century destroyed their lifestyle forever. Impoverished, enslaved and malnourished, the tribe lost most of its members to malaria and other illnesses- with just 300 members left in the world, the Mlabri are listed on UNESCO’s “endangered languages” list. 

Hammock weaving is the first proven path for Anong and her fellow Mlabri artisans to break free of the cycle of debt and servitude. Although she is a skilled artisan weaver, she has often been pulled back into the fields when there were not enough hammock orders. Raising three children while moving from place to place in the slash & burn fields has been daunting, and she is very excited to use this loan to create a more stable life for her children and begin to save for the future.

loans.use: invest in raw materials to ensure steady income and create a more stable life for her family

loans.name: Eet

texts.en:
Eet and her husband are both members of the Mlabri tribe, and they are two of the Mlabri who feel most strongly about education and the opportunity to provide a strong foundation for their children. 

Eet always had great potential as a student and fought to be able to study through part of secondary school, but her family’s immediate needs won out over her long-term education. Even as a child, her hands were needed in the fields to ensure that the family escaped malnourishment. 

As a member of the Mlabri, Eet has faced an uphill battle for her entire life. The Mlabri and other hill tribes had been denied citizenship, making it extremely difficult to obtain schooling, healthcare, and even basic civil rights. Because the Mlabri only recently transitioned from their reclusive past as hunter & gatherers, they have been taken advantage of by stronger, more modern neighboring tribes. Eet and many of her fellow Mlabri were forced to work in slash & burn agriculture as indentured servants without hope of escape from a life of back-breaking field labor. 

Despite this tragic history, weaving hammocks has created a new path for Eet- she and her fellow weavers are some of the first Mlabri to escape the cycle of false debt and begin to build a brighter future for their children. Eet and her husband have kept up their studies and they are one of the few Mlabri couples who can speak, read and write in the Thai language. They are devoted to their children’s education and wellbeing and are working hard to improve their lives. This loan is a part of their long-term plan to stabilize their income and expand their opportunities.

loans.use: invest in raw materials so she can secure consistent weaving work and increase her income potential.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai and her husband are members of the Mlabri, a small hill tribe in rural northern Thailand. Life among the Mlabri has changed rapidly over the past two decades and the world that 19-year-old Mai was born into is very different from the one her mother experienced.

Up until the mid-20th century, the Mlabri were a self-sustaining hunter & gatherer society who had almost zero contact with the outside world. Teak logging, guerrilla warfare and industrial development robbed them of their forest home and led the Mlabri through a sustained period of deprivation—they were forced into indentured servitude for neighboring tribes and many Mlabri died of malnourishment, malaria and contact with poisonous pesticides used in slash & burn farming. With fewer than 300 Mlabri left in the world, their future was uncertain. 

Over the past decade, hammock weaving has helped engineer a turnaround for the Mlabri in the Ban Boonyuen Village, where Mai and her husand live. For a hard worker like Mai, there are new opportunities that were unheard of for the previous generation. As a hammock weaver, she could earn as much as a college-educated teacher in her province. Her husband dreams of planting their own rice crops near the village. Together, they are trying to find ways to improve their lives without taking on debt from unethical middlemen who will trap them in an endless repayment cycle. This loan will help ensure that Mai can earn a stable income from hammock weaving and help them thrive in the modern world as they begin their life together.

loans.use: ensure that Mai can earn a stable income from hammock weaving.

loans.name: Naburereya A Group

texts.en:
George is a member of a group of 12 farmers located in Bungoma South District. George is pictured on the right of Naburereya A Group with his hand raised amongst the four men and eight women of his group. He will receive input loans capable of planting half an acre with sorghum, millet, and maize. 

George first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2009 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. George joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family and he used his increased profits to send his children to school.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, George was only able to harvest three bags of maize per half acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, he was able to harvest seven bags per half acre. He plans on using future profits from the harvest to send his children to school and save for the future. 

During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive half an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. George’s group will receive six acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum

loans.name: Subhi

texts.en:
Subhi is a 44-year-old man and married with two children. He is a farmer and has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 10 years. During these years, Subhi gained enough skills and experience to run the business. He chose this crop business because it is profitable and fresh fruits and vegetables are in high demand. 

People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy. Many national dishes, like pilau and dolma, are made of vegetables. Fresh fruits are served on every table of Azerbaijan families and also used to make fresh punch. He usually sells his crop at a bazaar. His monthly income is 300 AZN.

As these products are in high demand, Subhi wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose he applied for 1,000 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Hasiye

texts.en:
Hasiye is a 58-year-old woman, married with eight children. She is IDP and lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Hasiye has bred cattle and sheep for the last 20 years. She was a housewife and her husband`s salary was too low to cover the family's need, so Hasiye decided to start her business. 
 
Hasiye usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and then resells them in the livestock market. Her monthly income is 110 AZN; this business is main source of income for her family. 

Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan. People use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Hasiye wants to expand her business and improve the living conditions of her family. She has applied for a 2,500 AZN loan to purchase three cattle and fodder. She has already successfully completed more than five loans and is a trusted client of AqroInvest!

loans.use: to buy three cattle and fodder.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en: Mwanamisi is taking out another Kiva loan of 15,000 KES. She wants to purchase beverages and supplies to make food to sell. She is grateful for the support that she has received from Yehu and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy beverages and supplies to make food to sell.

loans.name: Ismayil

texts.en:
Ismayil is 47 years old. He is an IDP who lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and two sons. He is a farmer who has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last ten years. Ismayil chose this business because it is profitable and fresh crops are in high demand. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy; many national dishes are made from vegetable, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are on every table in Azerbaijan and also are used to make fresh punch.

Ismayil sells his crop in the Bilasuvar central bazaar. His monthly income is 120 AZN. His father actively helps him to raise crops.

As his products are in high demand, Ismayil wants to expand his business and grow more fruits and vegetables to meet market demand. For this purpose he applied for 2,000 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers. This will be his fifth loan; he has good client history.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Duman

texts.en:
Duman is a 21-year-old single man. He is IDP and lives with his parents in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He breeds cows and sells milk and milk products, as well as beef cattle to local butchers. Duman has three years of experience in this field, thanks to his father who taught him how to best look after cattle. He receives 80 AZN monthly in financial support from the government, but this is too low to cover his family's needs.

Duman usually buys small cattle, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and resells them in the local livestock bazaar. He sells milk and yoghurt to the neighbors. Selling milk and beef earns him 120 AZN per month. Milk and yoghurt, as well as meat, are very popular in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes, such as pilau and dolma. They always use yoghurt as a sauce. Milk products are consider very healthy and are a popular part of their diet. 

This represents the only financial income for his family and to makes savings for his future family when he will decide to get marry. Duman has applied for 600 AZN to purchase one dairy cow and feed.

loans.use: to buy one dairy cow and feed.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es: El señor Jose, hombre trabajador, casado, junto a su esposa e hijos a luchado mucho en la vida para mejorar de vida, con este nuevo credito dara mantenimiento a su cultivo de Yuca para poder obtener buena cosecha, comprara lo siguiente: Fertilizantes, Urea, Completo y Madera de yuca. Agradece el apoyo brindado por Afodenic y fondos Kiva durantes estos años.
texts.en: José, is a hard-working man. He is married and he and his wife struggle a lot to improve their lives.  He will use this new loan to maintain his yucca plants so that he will be able to obtain a good harvest.  He will purchase fertilizer, urea, “Fertilizante Completo” (fertilizer that contains three basic components: nitrogen, phosphoric acid and potassium*) and yucca stalks. He is grateful for the support provided by Afondec and Kiva over the years.

loans.use: to maintain yucca crops.

loans.name: Amridin

texts.ru: Амридину 23-года. Он женат. У него двое маленьких детей. Амридин уже два года как занимается торговлей. У Амридина имеется торговая точка, где он продает одежду и обувь. Амридин берет кредит для покупки весенней мужской одежды и обуви с целью увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en: Amridin is 23 years old.  He is married.  He has two small children.  Amridin has been selling for two years.  Amridin has a sales location where he sells clothing and shoes.  Amridin is taking out a loan for the purchase of spring men's clothing and shoes in order to increase his product assortment.

loans.use: to purchase men's spring clothing and shoes

loans.name: Spartak

texts.en:
Spartak is a 26-year-old single man who lives in a village not far from a city located in the northwest of Albania. He is taking his Masters degree in informatics part-time and in addition he has been running an internet café for three years.

“From the very beginning, I have experienced a steady clientele because it is the only such place here in the village because of the internet service costs for families. Young kids, who frequent my café, are in fact supervised. I watch them closely on what they browse and their parents rely on me for this.  Now, I want to add some PlayStations to attract children. This is why I need this loan,” said Spartak.

loans.use: to add some PlayStations to his internet cafe

loans.name: Mirzorahmat

texts.ru: Мирзорахмату 37 лет. Он со своей семьей проживает в районе Кумсангир. Мирзорахмат хочет начать новый бизнес и выбрал область животноводства. Его интересует купля продажа скота. Из-за нехватки денежных средств он обратился за кредитом для реализации своей цели. Мирзорахмат после откорма скота будет продавать его на рынке с наценкой. Прибыль с новой деятельности он будет копить на ремонт своего дома и на свадебное приданое старшей дочери.
texts.en: Mirzorahmat is 37 years old.  He lives with his family in the Qumsangir region.  Mirzorahmat wants to begin a new business and chose the livestock sector.  He is interested in buying and selling cattle.  Due to a lack of funds, he has requested a loan to realize his goals.  After fattening his cattle, Mirzorahmat will sell them at market for a premium.  He will save the profits from his new endeavor to make repairs on his home and for the wedding dowry of his oldest daughter.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is from the village Dzirkoki. He is 26 years old, married and lives with his wife and two children, who go to the local kindergarten. 

David works as a fireman and gets a monthly income. Besides, he transports wood with his motorbike and sells it among his villagers. The family also owns a vineyard and sells the harvested grapes seasonally. 

David received the loan in the framework of a start-up program. He will start a new family business with the loan. He plans to purchase piglets. After several months the raised pigs will be sold for a good price. He will also purchase a new motorbike and transport more wood from the forest. The rest of the borrowed money will be used for purchasing dishes for resale. David’s wife will sell the vessels among villagers and this will significantly increase the family income. David will be able to purchase building materials and renovate his house, which is old and damaged. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, dishes for resale and a new motorbike.

loans.name: Sevindj

texts.en: Sevindj has two beautiful children, a girl and a boy. Her husband divorced her. He doesn't help Sevindj or the children. She began to work after he divorced her. Sevindj has been in business for four years. She is 32 years old. Sevindj needs to borrow 2,300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy a new computer for her work. She teaches children, at her home.

loans.use: to buy a new computer, for her home-based teaching business

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Ms. Shamim is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. She has been doing tailoring work for many years. Her husband’s income alone is not enough to support the needs of the family. This compelled Shamim to initiate her own business of stitching clothes. She sews for the people living near her home and uses the income to help support her entire family. 

To help her continue operation of her business, she has requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy a stock of threads in different colors, along with packs of zippers and buttons. This will enable her to meet up with increasing demand for her services. Shamim desires to provide good and quality education to her children for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons to meet  increasing demand.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Ms Nasreen is a vigorous woman who has been doing stitching work for many years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  Nasreen serves her community well and earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue business operations, Nasreen has requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy more spools of thread in different colors, packs of zippers, buttons and ribbons to satisfy increasing customer demand without fail. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy more thread, zippers, buttons and ribbons to satisfy increasing customer demand

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married with six children, and only two of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (old parents).  

Margaret has a retail shop business and has been in this business for ten years. She generates additional income from rental rooms. She works in the shop seven days out of every week.  

She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, cooking oil and a 50kg bag of rice. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality.  

Margaret aspires to own a fully stocked shop and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, cooking oil and 50kg of rice.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Ms. Aisha is a 49-year-old married woman who has enjoyed making parandas for many years. Paranda is considered a traditional hair accessory in Pakistan, where women use it for a traditional look on special occasions such as Eid (a holiday) and weddings. Aisha makes beautiful parandas, especially for bridal hairstyles.

Aisha initiated her business with the support of Kashf foundation. Taking a loan from Kashf helped her account for expenses she thought she could never bear. Aisha is striving hard to meet her family expenditures. She is responsible for providing the family with a good environment consisting of good food, clothing, and education. Aisha needs a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy raw material such as colorful threads, beads, mirrors, and pearls for embellishment. This would help attract more customers, which ultimately helps in generating more cash. Aisha is in her 3rd loan cycle, with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy raw material such as colorful threads, beads, mirrors, and pearls

loans.name: Syedauzma

texts.en: Ms Syedauzma is a vigorous lady who has been running a clothing business for many years. She offers various clothes in different colors and designs by taking into account the demands of her customers. She makes enough to lead a decent life. Her collection is much appreciated by the people of her community. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PKR to purchase a greater variety of winter season clothes to improve her business. She hopes to get an increase in her sales which ultimately helps in generating more cash. She dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of winter season clothes to increase her sales.

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es:
Juan, es un humilde pescador con un espíritu emprendedor, tiene 39 años de edad, originario de la comunidad Las Peñitas, en las afueras de León, padre de 6 hijos. Además de dedicarse a la pesca tiene una pequeña pulpería en su casa. Puso este negocio como una forma de conseguir otros ingresos pues la pesca no siempre está en temporada alta y su familia necesita comer y vestirse, sus hijos tiene que estudiar así que el busca la manera como salir adelante en medio de su pobreza. Su expectativa es mejorar los productos para su pulpería pues no hay muchas cerca de donde vive pero son necesarias pues se puede comprar productos por unidad, aunque su negocio sea pequeño no deja de recibir constantes visitas de clientes en busca de alimentos.
Él está necesitando el financiamiento para comprar aceite, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, jabón, detergentes, pan, huevo, leche, sal. Poco a poco desea ir surtiendo de más productos su pulpería entre sus planes futuros esta comprar una lancha nueva para pescar en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Juan is a humble, 39 year old fisherman and father of six with an entrepreneurial spirit.  He is originally from the Las Peñitas community in the outskirts of Leon.  In addition to fishing, he has a small grocery store in his home.  He opened this business as a means to bring other forms of income because fishing is seasonal and his family needs to eat and be clothed.  His children must study so he finds ways to fight poverty.  He hopes to improve the products at his store as there are not many other stores in his area but they are necessary.  Despite having a small business, he still has frequent visitors looking for products.  

He is seeking financing to purchase oil, beans, rice, sugar, soap, detergents, bread, eggs, milk, and salt.  Little by little he hopes to keep introducing more products at his store.  One of his future goals is to purchase a new boat so that he can fish in better conditions.

loans.use: to purchase oil, beans, rice, sugar, soap, detergents, bread, eggs, milk, and salt.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Ms Razia is a 47-year-old widow and the mother of five children. She strives hard to meet the family's demands, including food, clothing, and education. Five years ago, Razia started her stitching business to contribute to the family income. She is very familiar with the stitching techniques and makes enough to lead a decent life. In order to cope with the increasing demands of her customers, Razia has requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy more spools of thread in different colors, packs of needles and buttons. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy more thread, needles and buttons.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.ru:
Гоар  родилась и живет  в городе Каджаран ,что в Сюникской области.Она в разводе и живет вместе с двумя дочерьми, которым по 3 и 2 годика.
Гоар нигде не работала раньше но после развода она начала заниматься перепродажей одежды и белья и другими аксессуарами . Раз в неделю Гоар ездит в Ереван и с оптовых складов и рынков покупает товар и перепродает их в родном городе Каджаране. 
У нее уже появились постоянные клиенты даже из соседних деревень. 
Как одинокой молодой матери двоих детей Гоару очень трудно справиться с бытом  , но ей помогает во всем ее мать которая живет неподолеку от города Каджаран :  в соседнем городе Капан. 
Она хочет вырасти своих детей достойными и образованными  гражданами своей страны  и для этого ничего не жалеет.  
Гоар просит от Кива кредит на сумму 500.000 Армянских драм для покупки и перепродажи новой партии весенней одежды из Еревана.
texts.en:
Gohar was born and lives in the town of Kadjaran, Syuniski region. She is divorced and lives with her two daughters, aged 2 and 3. 

Gohar never worked before but after the divorce began to resell clothes, linens and other accessories. Once a week, Gohar travels to Yerevan and buys goods from wholesalers and markets, then resells them in her hometown of Kadjaran.

She already has regular customers from neighboring villages.

As a young, single mother of two, Gohar finds it very difficult to cope with everyday life, but she is helped with everything by her mother who lives in the nearby town of Kapan. 

She wants her children to grow up as decent and educated citizens of the country, and for this there will be no regrets. 

Gohar is asking for a Kiva loan of 500,000 Armenian drams to buy and resell a new batch of spring clothing from Yerevan.

loans.use: to buy a new spring clothing collection from Yerevan

loans.name: Emasafu Group

texts.en:
Catherine’s group has ten farmers and is located in Kakamega South District. Catherine is pictured on the right of the Emasafu Group with her hand raised. Catherine is pictured amongst the five men and five women of her group. She will receive input loans allowing her to plant ½ an acre with sorghum, millet, and maize. Catherine joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2011, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Catherine joined One Acre Fund so that she could gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and grow enough food for the family.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Catherine was only able to harvest one bag of maize per ½ acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2011, she was able to harvest eight bags per ½ acre! She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and to save for the future. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Catherine’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on five acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en: Ms Nargis is a 27-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She has had a stitching  business for many years. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her family members. She started her business because she realized that if her husband works alone for the family, he will not be able to meet the expenses of the household including the educational needs of their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. She has requested a loan of 25,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation to purchase more spools of threads, as well as packs of buttons and laces in various colors. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demands of her customers consistently. Nargis hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads as well as packs of buttons and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Carolina De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Carolina de 49 años de edad, originaria de Managua, casada, madre de 1 hijos de 15 años, de oficio comerciante, es dueña de una pulpería. Inicio su actividad laboral con capital propio, dinero que tenia ahorrado de la liquidación de su anterior trabajo, luego con el tiempo decidió emprender su propio negocio como es el de la pulpería en su casa de habitación, negocio que le genera ganancias a diarias, la cual se siente muy satisfecha  ya que ha podido salir adelante con su familia, sus expectativas es seguir agregando mas productos al inventario de su pulpería para incrementar sus ventas.
En esta ocasión Ella esta requiriendo el financiamiento para  comprar granos básicos como arroz, azúcar, frijoles y a la misma vez  para comprar frutas  como melón, papaya, piña, etc. Para elaborar  batidos de frutas, para ofrecer algo nuevo a sus clientes, y de esta manera obtener ingresos extras para seguir creciendo en su negocio, sus planes futuro es mejorar la infraestructura del local en donde tiene su negocio para darle una mejor presentación.
texts.en:
Carolina is a 49 year old woman from Managua.  She is married and the mother of a 15 year old son.  She owns a small general store.  She started her business with her own capital, money she had saved from severance pay she received from her previous job.  Then, in time, she decided to start her own business, a small general store in the house where she lives.  This business generates profits daily and she is very satisfied with it because she has been able to get her family ahead.  She hopes to continue adding more products to the store’s inventory in order to increase sales.

At this time, she is requesting the loan to purchase basic grains such as rice, sugar, and beans, as well as fruits such as melons, papayas, and pineapples to make fruit shakes which enable her to offer her customers something new.  In this way, she will earn extra income and continue growing her business.  Her future plan is to make structural improvements to her business location to give it a better appearance.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains such as rice, sugar, and beans as well as fruits such as melons, papayas, and pineapples.

loans.name: Rosa Ramona

texts.es:
Rosa, una humilde  señora de 57 años de edad,  originaria de  Managua, soltera, madre de 4 hijos de mayores de edad, todos son independiente, de oficio comerciante, es dueña de una pulpería. Inicio en el ámbito del comercio vendiendo ropa usada de forma ambulante ya que necesitaba un medio del cual subsistir, es por  eso que hoy en día  con mucho esfuerzo y arduo trabajo ha logrado emprender otro negocio como es el de la pulpería, se siente muy orgullosa porque ha podido incrementar sus ventas y obtener mejores ganancias, en el negocio cuenta con el apoyo de su nieta, tiene otros ingresos como es la remesas que le envían  familiares que viven en Costa Rica, sus expectativas es mejorar las condiciones del local para darle una mejor presentación a su negocio.
Rosa esta requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar una vitrina y a la misma vez comprar útiles escolares como cuadernos, lapiceros, borrador, uniformes, etc. con el objetivo de ofrecer mas productos que aun no tiene en inventario en  su pulpería, para satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela y de esta manera poder incrementar  las ventas para obtener mejores ingresos, uno de sus planes futuros es convertir su  pulpería en una miscelánea para hacer una empresaria exitosa.
texts.en:
Rosa, 57, is a humble woman. Originally from Managua, she is single and is the mother of four grown children, all of whom are independent. She owns a small grocery store. She started out as a street vendor selling second-hand clothing, because she needed a means to survive. Through a lot of effort and hard work, she has started another business, which is the grocery store. She is very proud because she has been able to increase her sales and earn a better income. In the business, she has the support of her granddaughter. She has other incomes, like the remittances that family members in Costa Rica send to her. Her hope is to improve the conditions of her store, to give her business a better appearance. 

Rosa needs financing to buy a display case and school supplies like notebooks, pencils, erasers, uniforms, etc, with the goal of offering more products that she doesn't yet have in her store's inventory. This is to meet her customers' needs and to be able to increase her sales to get better earnings. One of her plans for the future is to turn her grocery store into a general store so she can be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy a display case, as well as school supplies like notebooks, pencils, erasers, uniforms, etc.

loans.name: María Elsa

texts.es: La señora Maria, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe en la Comarca llamada Francia No. 2, junto a su  familia trabaja la Tierra para salir adelante y mejorar sus condiciones de vida, ella se encuentra muy contenta por que gracias a este nuevo credito  podra darle Mantenimiento a su Cultivos de Piña y asi lograr una buena cosecha ya que sus productos seran de calidad. Agradece el apoyo y la confianza que le han brindado Afodenic y Fondos Kiva
texts.en: Maria lives in the Ticuantepe municipality in the region known as Francia No. 2. Along with her family, she works the land in order to move forward and improve her quality of life. She is very happy because thanks to this new loan, she will be able to tend her pineapple crops and get a good harvest, since her products will be quality. She is thankful for the help and the trust that Afodenic and Kiva funds have given her.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en:
Bakari, 51 years old, is an auto mechanic who repairs motorcycles, bicycles and cars. This he has done for 17 years. He is married with ten children, and his greatest expenditures are buying food and paying school fees, as seven of his children are in school.

Bakari is approaching a loan request amounting to 20,000 Kenya shillings, which he will use to acquire more spare parts, tools, and equipment to enable him to serve his customers better. 

With the new profit, Bakari will expand his business. He uses his income to provide shelter, food and clothes for his children. He is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to acquire more spare parts, tools and equipment.

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.es: La Señora Rosibel habita en el munucipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo e hijos, ella labora para un Restaurante, y su esposa para una empresa privada, entre los dos se dividen los gastos del Hogar. su mayor sueño es tener su casa propia para darle mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos, su mayor dificultad es que no pueden reunir d eu na sola vez el dinero para comprar los materiales que necesita para realizar las mejoras en su hogar. agradece el apyo brindado con este credito.
texts.en: Rosibel lives in the Ticuantepe municipality, together with her husband and children. She works in a restaurant and her husband works in a private company. They divide the household expenses between them. Her greatest dream is to have her own house in order to give her children a better quality of life. Her greatest problem is that they couldn't gather all the money at once that they needed to make some home improvements. She is grateful for the help this loan provides.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Romancita Maria

texts.es: Romancita, 52 años de edad, habitante de la comunidad Chacaraseca, en las afueras de León , casada, madre de  6 hijos , se dedica a criar cerdos , anteriormente se dedicaba a sembrar y vender maíz con las ganancias obtenidas comenzó a invertir en la compra de cerdos. Actualmente solo se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos, negocio que le ha dejado buenos ingresos . Pero necesita tener a sus animales en mejores condiciones por ese motivo solicito el financiamiento para comprar cerdos y construir una galera para que sus cerditos tengan un lugar donde puedan desarrollarse en condiciones limpias, sanos y fuertes. Pues son parte de las características buscan los clientes  al momento de comprar.
texts.en: Fifty-two-year-old Romancita lives in the community of Chacaraseca on the outskirts of León.  She is married and has six children.  She raises pigs for a living; she used to grow and sell corn and with the earnings from that she started to buy pigs.  Currently, she only raises and sells pigs, which has made her good profits.  However, she needs better conditions for her animals,  which is why she is asking for this loan to buy pigs and to build a shelter so her little pigs can have a place to develop under clean, healthy, strong conditions.  These are the things customers look for when they buy.

loans.use: to buy pigs and to build a shelter

loans.name: Paoj Tzununul Group

texts.es:
La señora Catarina esta soltera, tiene 24 años de edad, curso los 3 años de educacion primaria, tiene 2 hijos los cuales aun no estudian, se dedica al comercio a la atención a una tienda en general, inicio este negocio con el propósito de apoyar a su comunidad, ya que no había tienda donde vive, hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura.

Organizar un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo, que sera invertido para la compra de productos para su tienda, la compra de artículos de consumo diarios para la cocina, golosinas, aguas gaseosa, jugos, lácteos, etc. Espera tener la mejor tienda del sector. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio y a la agricultura.
texts.en:
Catarina is single, 24 years old, and has 3 years of primary education. She has two children who are not in school yet. She makes a living in sales working at a general store. She started this business with the purpose of supporting her community, since a store did not used to exist where she lives. So far she has 10 years of experience, and has the support of her husband who is engaged in agriculture.

She organized a group to apply for a loan, which will be invested in the purchase of products for her store, such as everyday goods for the kitchen, candy, soft drinks, juices, dairy products, etc. She hopes to have the best shop in her sector. The other members of the group make a living in sales and agriculture.

loans.use: to buy products for her general store such as candy, soft drinks, juices, dairy products, etc.

loans.name: Luis Arnoldo

texts.es:
Luis, 30 años de edad, soltero, de oficio agricultor, con estudios básicos de primaria, originario de la comarca San Lorenzo en las afueras de Teustepe. Empezó a trabajar con su padre y hermanos desde los 8 años de edad. El siembra frijol, una de sus actividades favoritas es el engorde de animales y trabajar en la crianza y cuido del ganado actividad que realiza durante el verano y en el invierno dedica su tiempo a sembrar frijol, maíz y trigo.   
El requiere el financiamiento para comprar una vaquila. De esta manera buscar cómo mejorar la producción de leche y ganado para vender, siempre con el objetivo de tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis, 30 years old, is single and a farmer. He has a basic primary education and is originally from the region of San Lorenzo in the suburbs of Teustepe. He began to work with his father and brothers at 8 years old. 

He plants beans. One of his favorite activities is the fattening of animals and working at raising and caring for his livestock, an activity that he performs during the summer. In the winter, he dedicates his time to planting beans, corn, and wheat.

He requires the funding to buy a heifer. In this way, he will search for how to improve the production of milk and livestock to sell, always with the goal of having a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a heifer.

loans.name: Mahmoda

texts.en: Ms Mahmoda is a 55-year-old woman and is successfully running a small school canteen. She has gained five years of experience in this field and earns enough to meet the needs of the family members.  She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide them with good quality food, clothing and education. She wants to grow her business so she has requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy packs of biscuits, cookies, sweets and beverages to cope with the increasing demand at her canteen. She is in her seventh loan cycle with a good repayment history. She expects a boost in her earnings and dreams of providing her children with a quality education.

loans.use: to buy packs of biscuits, cookies, sweets and beverages to cope with the increasing demand at her canteen.

loans.name: Ghulam-Merium

texts.en: Ms Ghulam–Merium is a 32-year-old married woman. She has been running a business involving the buying and selling of animals. She buys small animals, brings them up and sells them around the occasion of Eid-Ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). She earns a good profit through her business and is able to manage the needs of the family members. Her husband also works in agriculture and assists her in running this business. For the improvement of her business she requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase two more goats. She wants to improve her standard of living through all of her hard work in the business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Nyamawi

texts.en:
Nyamawi is 46 years old, married and lives with his twelve children. He is very hard working and is always setting a good example at home as every morning he wakes up with new dreams and desires for prospering. He owns a butcher where he buys goats and sells the meat. His greatest expense is the payment of school fees as ten of his children are in school.
He has been a member of Yehu for four years and has shown responsibility with repayments and therefore he has requested a loan of 30000 KES to pay school fees. He is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to pay for school fees.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Ms. Shaheen is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of six children: three daughters and three sons. 

Shaheen has been successfully running a business of cattle rearing for many years and makes enough to contribute to the family income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. 

Currently, Shaheen applied for a loan of Rs. 35,000 to purchase two more goats and feed for her cattle. She is in her sixth loan cycle with a good repayment history. Shaheen expects a boost in her net income and wishes to spend part of it on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats and feed for her cattle.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Ms. Zahida is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She has been doing sewing for many years and serves well in her community. 

Zahida stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. 

In order to purchase a new sewing machine with spools of thread in various colors, Zahida contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 25,000. Then she would be able to meet with the demands of her customers without fail.  

Zahida hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine with spools of thread in various colors.

loans.name: Ejaz

texts.en: Ms Ejaz is 42 years old and married. She is the mother of three children. She has been successfully running a business of cattle raising for the past 25 years. Her husband is employed in a private sector but his income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family members alone. Ejaz makes enough to contribute to the family's income. For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 25,000. This will help her to purchase two more goats and feed for her cattle. She has been in association with Kashf for two years. She expects a boost in her net income and wishes to spend part of it on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats and feed for her cattle.

loans.name: José

texts.es: José vive en Puntarenas. Es una persona con amplia experiencia en la agricultura y ama lo que hace. El va ha sembrar semilla de maíz y frijol aprovechando el clima y la demanda del producto propia de época. Para eso solicita un préstamo de ₡600 000 (seiscientos mil colones) para la compra de las semillas, abonos e insecticidas, necesarios para la producción de estos granos. El desea aumentar su producción y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José lives in Puntarenas. He is a person with ample experience in agriculture and loves what he does. He is going to plant corn and bean seeds, taking advantage of the climate and the demand for the product suitable for the period of time.

Because of this, he is requesting a loan of ₡600 000 (six thousand colones) for the purchase of the seeds, fertilizer, and insecticides necessary for the production of these grains. He wants to increase production and therefore improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Siara

texts.en:
Ms Siara is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She is striving hard to meet their demands including food, clothing, and health. Her husband is employed in a small restaurant but his income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. She started her business of sewing clothes to contribute to the family income.

She has been in the sewing business for many years and is very familiar with the stitching techniques. She initiated her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; she took her first loan to buy a sewing machine. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. She has been in association with Kashf for five years. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy more spools of threads of different colors, as well as packs of buttons, zippers and laces. So then she will be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads of different colors, as well as packs of buttons, zippers and laces.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Ms Parveen is 42 years old and married. She has been running a business of vegetable sales for three years with the support of her son. The boy shown in the photo is Parveen’s son who assists her in dealing with customers and buying stocks of vegetables from the market at wholesale rates. At this time, Parveen has become famous in her community for selling fresh vegetables. She serves her community well and makes enough to contribute to the family's income. 

She is a mother of five children, two of whom are school going. She is motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.  Parveen has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation. Currently, she is requesting a loan of Rs 35,000. She intends to utilize this loan to purchase sacks of onions, potatoes and ginger to meet the customers’ demands time after time. She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of onions, potatoes and ginger

loans.name: Ndéo

texts.fr: Ndéo est une femme mariée, mère de quatre enfants.Elle pratique le commerce de denrées alimentaires depuis quelques années.Elle achète et vend du mil au marché de sa localité. Pour augmenter ses revenus, elle fait de l'embouche bovine en achetant un bœuf pour l'engraisser avant de le revendre.Ces activités lui permettent de prendre en charge ses propres besoins ainsi que ceux de sa famille.Afin de faire une nouvelle opération d'embouche, elle sollicite un pret de 50000f pour acheter un bœuf.Son ambition est de renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Ndéo is a married woman and the mother of four children.  She has been selling food products for a few years.  She buys and sells millet at her local market.  

As an additional source of income, she also fattens cattle: she buys one ox at a time and then fattens it for resale.  

These activities allow her to take care of her own needs as well as those of her family.  

In order to start fattening cattle again, she is requesting a loan of 50,000 francs to buy one ox.  Her ambition is to strengthen her activity.

loans.use: to buy one ox.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Ms. Mumtaz is a 41-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community. She has gained years of experience in this field. By this time, she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family's income. 

Mumtaz is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to buy stock of rice, sugar, and packs of beverages to cater to her customers consistently. 

Mumtaz is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar, and packs of beverages to cater to her customers consistently.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Ms Abida is a 26-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. She has been successfully running a business of cracker sales for many years. She deliciously makes them at home and then sells to the people of her community and makes enough through this business. Abida has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. She has requested a loan of 35,000 PKR. This will help her to purchase packs of oil, salt and flour to increase her sales. She hopes to have an increase in her net income and wants to spend part of it on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase packs of oil, salt and flour to increase her sales.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 53-year-old man. He is married to Virginia and supports a family of three people. He owns a motorcycle transport business and has been operating the business for the last three years. He comfortably makes a monthly income of KES 15,000. He is taking his fourth loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase another new motorbike to expand his business. He will use the anticipated profit to grow the business and also to pay school fees for his children.

His dream is to grow the business so that he can generate income to purchase a lorry for transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James used the previous loan to buy eucalyptus trees for timber. He is a 41-year-old married man with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling timber for 14 years, has a retail shop and is a farmer. His hardships are customers not paying on time, inadequate capital to purchase stock, and seasonal weather. His personal goals are educating his children, building a permanent house for his residence and self-education. His business goals are buying land to grow crops, expanding his business into new markets, and hiring employees to help expand the business. James wants money to buy soap, salt, sugar and manure.

loans.use: to buy soap, salt, sugar and manure.

loans.name: Nena

texts.es:
Nena tiene 28 años, soltera y con una gran responsabilidad familiar por sus padres y hermanos menores, además tiene una hija de 11 años. Ella reside en una vivienda construida a base de material noble que logró construir con mucho sacrificio.
Se desempeña como cosmetóloga y peluquera desde hace 3 años en un pequeño local alquilado. Comenta que al inicio no fue sencillo sacar adelante su negocio a falta de clientes pero que gracias a su paciencia y buen trato a logrado consolidar su negocio como un buen sustento para su economía familiar. 
Le agrada mucho su trabajo ya que se considera una persona detallista y capaz de desempeñar en esta actividad.
A manera de seguir mejorando su negocio desea realizar la compra de más mercadería cosmética e incrementar la afluencia de clientes en su negocio.
Sus planes a futuro apuntan a desplazarse a una ciudad mas grande e iniciar un negocio del mismo rubro pero a gran escala , esperando crecer como microempresaria en bienestar de su pequeña hija.
En esta ocasión desea contar con 2,000 nuevos soles  para la compra de cosméticos, tintes y productos de belleza para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Nena is 28 years old and single. She has a great sense of familial responsibility for her parents and younger siblings, as well as for her own 11-year-old daughter.  She lives in a home made of quality construction materials, which she managed to build with much sacrifice.  She has worked as a cosmetologist and hairdresser for the last 3 years in a small salon that she rents.  

Nena comments that at the beginning it was not easy to advance her business because she lacked customers, but thanks to her patience and good service she has managed to strengthen her business so it can economically sustain her family.  She likes her work very much, and considers herself to be detail-oriented and capable of performing in this business. 

In order to continue improving her business, she wants to buy more cosmetic merchandise and increase customer traffic to her salon.  Her future plans are to move to a bigger city and start a similar business that is larger scale, hoping to grow as a micro-entrepreneur to support the well-being of her young daughter.  On this occasion, she hopes to rely on this loan of 2,000 soles to buy cosmetics, dyes and beauty products to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, dyes and beauty products to improve her business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 41 years old. She is a widow with five children. The oldest is 19 and the youngest is 8 months. She has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy more charcoal to sell.  With the profit she will pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Liangale Group

texts.en:
Mary’s group has 13 farmers and is located in Kakamega south District. Mary is pictured on the right of the Liangege Group with her hand raised. Mary is pictured amongst the five men and eight women of her group. She will receive input loans allowing her to plant ½ an acre with sorghum, millet, and maize. Mary joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Mary joined One Acre Fund so that she could have a bumper harvest like her mum.

Mary reports that before One Acre Fund, she was able to grow about one bag of maize per ½ acre, but with her One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, she harvested six bags per 1/2 acre! She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and perhaps invest in another business. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Mary’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 6.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet and sorghum

loans.name: Tariel

texts.en:
Tariel is 56 years old, single and lives alone in Tkibuli District. Tariel runs an agricultural business. In particular, he owns beehives with bee colonies and sells the honey for a good price. Besides, he grows maize on the family-owned land and sells the harvested products seasonally. In addition, Tariel works as a joiner and earns monthly income. He is a very hard-working man with great experience in his work. 
He has requested a loan to renovate his house. His existing house is old and damaged. Tariel will purchase building materials and repair it. Then, his living conditions will improve and Tariel will be able to spend his evenings in a more comfortable environment after a hard day of work. Tariel hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to renovate his house.

loans.name: Papa Moussa

texts.fr: Monsieur Pape moussa est un homme célibataire. Il vit au Sénégal et pratique l’activité de  commerce depuis plus de 08 ans. Il vend des articles de mercerie et des produits cosmétiques. Il est membre  de  l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC où il sollicite un crédit d’un montant de 60.000 francs CFA dans le but de remettre en état le magasin ou il exerce son activité. Les revenus que lui procure son activité lui permettent de participer à la dépense quotidienne au sein de sa famille. Sa journée de travail  commence a 8 heures et se termine a 20 heures la nuit. Son objectif avec a travers la réfection de son magasin est d’attirer beaucoup plus de client afin d’accroitre son chiffre d’affaire et ses bénéfices, ce qui lui permettra de diversifier les produits qu’il commercialise. Il souhaite démarrer la vente de tissus et aussi élargir le nombre de ses employés à 2. Ainsi il pourra  contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions alimentaires au sein de sa famille. Son projet dans le futur consiste a mieux développer son activité de commerce et acquérir un magasin  plus spacieux afin de pouvoir satisfaire entièrement la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Papa Moussa is single and lives in Senegal.  He has been working in commerce for more than eight years, selling sewing supplies and cosmetic products.  He is a client of one of UIMCEC branches and is requesting a loan of 60,000 CFA francs to renovate his store.

With his income, he is able to contribute to the day-to-day expenses, within his family.  He works from 8 AM until 8 PM.  He wants to renovate his store in order to attract a much larger group of customers and increase his turnover and profits, which will allow him to diversify his inventory.  He would like to start selling fabrics and also to increase the number of his employees to two.  His goal is to be able to contribute to the improvement of his family's diet. 

In the future, Papa Moussa would like to better develop his commercial activity and buy a larger store, so that he can completely satisfy the demand from his customers.

loans.use: to renovate his shop.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is a 25-year-old married woman.  She supports her family of five by running a cafe.  She has run the business for three years, and earns 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) per month. 

Tabitha has asked for a loan of 15,000 KES from KADET LTD. She wants to use the loan to buys stocks for her business, for example wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat. 

With the anticipated increased profit from her business, Tabitha plans to replay the loan.  She hopes for a prosperous business and a happy family.

loans.use: To purchase cooking fat, wheat flour and maize flour.

loans.name: Emmanueline

texts.en:
Emmanueline is a 38-year-old married woman with three children.  She lives in Kasese, Uganda, and has worked hard as a health information assistant for six years.

Emmanueline's personal goals are to educate her children up to university level, and to open up a drug store to supplement her salary. She is planning to use this loan to pay for school fees for her children.  She has previously borrowed money for the same purpose.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is 33 years old. She is married with four children. The oldest is 16 years old and the youngest is 11 years old. Her husband is a driver. She has been in business for seven years selling meat. She wants a loan to buy more meat to sell. With the profit, she will pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more meats for sale.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is 46 years old, married with four children aged between five and 15 years old. He slaughters livestock and sells the meat in Kapsabet town. He has operated the business for nine years earning an income of 60,000 KES monthly. He has requested his third loan of 30,000 KES from KADET LTD and wishes to use this amount to pay his children's school fees.  

The profits he gets from his business will be used to repay the loan and the remaining profits will be ploughed back into his business. His dream is to educate his children and prosper in his business.

loans.use: To pay his children's school fees.

loans.name: Hindu

texts.en: Hindu is a single mother of three children and two of her children go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members (mother). She has a business selling used clothes. She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 500,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes.  She has been in this clothing business for three years, selling to all categories of people but at retail at the market. She works six days a week both on a wholesale and retail basis.  Her major business challenge includes thieves and seasonality. She is aspiring to import used clothes to sell on a wholesale basis only. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Floride

texts.en:
Floride is a 62-year-old widow, with two grown-up children aged 21 and 27 years old.  She has been in business for ten years, selling food locally.  

Floride has asked for a loan to buy more cabbages to sell. With the anticpated increased profits she will generate, Floride plans to add to her savings.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for sale, such as cabbages.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 53-year-old hardworking married man with nine kids. He lives in Msambweni, Kenya with her family in his own home. He works selling clothing for women, men, and children and has a variety of shirts, dresses, pants, and other items. He has had this business for 10 years and this has given him lots of sales experience, allowing him to obtain better income. He sells his goods by traveling to different neighborhoods, and from home. He has built up a good customer base, and people choose him as he always has what they need at affordable prices and sells quality products with excellent customer service.

He has requested a loan of Ksh 30,000 to buy materials and tape measures. He is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy materials and tape measures.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is from Tiribe. She has her own home, with children. She is a very hard-working, responsible and very honest woman. Her husband earns a living selling various products. 

Her dream has always been to have a well-supplied general store in order to be able to generate more income and thus be able to have a better quality of life for her and her whole family. With her effort, work and dedication, she succeeded, reaching her goals without any type of problem. Today, she has the shop she dreamed of and she is requesting this loan in order to be able to purchase extra goods including drinks, food products, vegetables and milk. She is grateful for this opportunity that she is receiving.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, food products, vegetables, milk and more.

loans.name: Mastula

texts.en:
Mastula is married with five children, three of whom go to school. She has been running a business selling all sorts of used clothes for five years. She works seven days a week, and moves every day to sell to a different area. Mastula generates extra income by working in a beauty salon. She lives in her own house, and her family has access to electricity but not piped water. 

Mastula has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT-SACCO so she can buy more bales of used clothes. Her main business challenges include transportation and seasonality. Mastula dreams of getting a permanent premises for her business, and to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan is a single mother of two children, both of whom go to school. She has a fish-selling business and has been in this business for three years. She has applied for a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy more baskets of fish. She sells fish on a wholesale basis only. She works at the market six days a week. She generates additional income through selling charcoal. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality.  She aspires to own a delivery van to improve the ease of transportation and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of fish

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia is 29 years old, married and a mother of one child. For the last three years, she has earned a living by selling clothes in Mpeketoni, Lamu. She earns a monthly income of KES 18,000. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and is applying for her second loan of KES 40,000 to buy additional stock for her business such as dresses, blouses, trousers, shirts and so on to sell to her customers.

She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay for her child's school fees as well as expand her business. Her goal for the future is to continue growing her business so that she can help give her family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her business such as dresses, blouses, trousers, shirts and so on to sell

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik is from Azatan village of Shirak region. She is 48 years old and lives with her husband, son and father-in-law. 
Together with her husband and son, Hasmik is involved in agriculture. She cultivates wheat and potato and does her best to gather a good harvest. Her husband and son sell the gathered harvest in the local market and get income which is hardly enough for covering family's costs.
Realizing that the profit from the agricultural business is very important for the family, Hasmik has applied for this loan.
With the help of the loan Hasmik plans to purchase potato seeds and expand the potato cultivation business. This will help her to make more income and ensure a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds.

loans.name: Murtaz

texts.en: Murtaz is 60 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and 32-year-old son in Tkibuli district, West Georgia. Murtaz is a joiner and gets orders to produce different kinds of wooden materials with his own sawing installation. In addition, he is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has a milk cow, whose milk is used in cheese production. His wife produces cheese and sells it at local market. At the same time, they have a plot of agricultural land, where nut trees are grown. Murtaz sells the harvested nuts locally. Each member of the family works hard to insure a good harvest. Murtaz requested a loan for purchasing piglets and building a shed for the piglets. He plans to expand the livestock and increase the income of the family. With the increased income, they will improve their living conditions. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and to build a shed for them

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a thirty-year-old hardworking man living in Kasese, Uganda. He has worked as a community development officer for four years, working with children, mothers and HIV-infected people.  He also has a motorcycle transport business for additional income. 

Benson has applied for a loan to pay for school fees for himself. He hopes to have a high-paying job after graduating, despite the challenges of low income and heavy work load which limit his ability to concentrate on his studies.

loans.use: to pay school fees for himself.

loans.name: Janviere

texts.en:
Janviere is a 36-year-old married woman with three children, aged between one and seventeen years old.  She has worked for thirteen years, and her husband is her partner in business. 

Janviere has asked for a loan to buy more bananas for sale.  She plans to add to her savings with the anticipated increased profits from her business.

loans.use: To buy more bananas for sale.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is a 46-year-old married woman with four children, living in Kasese, Uganda.  For ten years, she has been selling local brew, and she has been able to pay for school fees for her children with the proceeds.  She has applied for a loan to buy more local brew for resale. 

Justine is a good mother, and despite her low income she dreams of educating her children up to university level.  For herself, her goal is to own a bar selling a variety of spirits.

loans.use: to buy local brew to sell.

loans.name: Mwenda

texts.en:
Mwenda is from Tiribe. She's a merchant and the owner of a food market. She has been doing this work for more than ten years and she has become very well known among the customers who go there.

Mwenda's a person with a lot of enthusiasm who likes to get ahead. That's why she works so hard. She works from very early in the morning to prepare the dishes she sells, and she returns home late at night.

She's requesting this loan to be able to buy beverages and supplies for her dishes. This is what she most needs and uses every day.

She's grateful for this opportunity, because with it she's making progress.

loans.use: to buy beverages and supplies for her dishes.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 27-year-old married woman with two children aged one month and four years old.  Her husband is a mechanic. 

Sarah has been in business for five years selling food.  She has asked for a loan to buy more bananas, potatoes and beans.  She plans to add to her savings with the anticipated increase in profits from the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, potatoes and beans for sale.

loans.name: Hripsik

texts.en:
Hripsik has been involved in agriculture for the last ten years. She is 27-years-old and married with four children. Despite her young age, Hripsik, together with her husband, works hard to sustain her children. She breeds cattle, cultivates wheat and grows apricot and peach trees. Her livestock currently includes six cows and nine bulls.
The main income for this family comes from their agricultural business, so Hripsik would like to expand it. 
She has applied for this loan to purchase forage for feeding the livestock and seeds for cultivation. 
The loan is very important for Hripsik to gather a higher income and ensure a better future for her children.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock and seeds for cultivation

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 39 years old, married and a mother of two children. She sells fruits and vegetables as well as fish in Malindi for a living where she earns a monthly income of about 5,000 KES (Kenyan shillings). 


She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. She has applied for a loan of  20,000 KES to purchase more stocks of fish and vegetables to sell.

Mary intends to continue growing her business and hopes that one day she will come to own a well established retail shop in the area.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of fish and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is 33 years old and supports only himself. For the past 4 years, he has owned an M-Pesa service (mobile phone-based cash transfers and other financial services) in Kapsabet, earning an income of KES 10,000. Godfrey is now servicing his second term loan of KES 70,000 from KADET LTD to increase his business float and to purchase phone accessories for his business. Godfrey will use the profits he earns to repay the loan and to save for future investments. He hopes to have a family and live a better life.

loans.use: To add to his M-PESA business float.

loans.name: Rahim

texts.en: Rahim, 50 years old, is married and has two children, aged 18 and 16. He is the only income earner in his family. Rahim is a tailor with 30 years’ experience. He repairs vehicle seats and sews new covers for seats. Rahim is a very cautious, responsible and respectable man among his clients. His plan is to get new sewing machines to improve the quality of the work and to expand his business. Rahim has requested a loan to purchase thread and other materials required for tailoring.

loans.use: To purchase thread and other materials required for tailoring.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah, 30 years old, is married and supports four members of her family. Her children are aged between 1 and 7 years old. For the past year, Hannah has been preparing and selling soup, earning an income of KES 10,000. Hannah is now servicing her first loan of KES 10,000 from KADET LTD to purchase bone marrow and other ingredients to prepare soup for sale. She will use the profits she earns to repay the loan. Hannah hopes to educate her children to greater heights.

loans.use: To purchase bone marrow to prepare soup for sale

loans.name: Nayil

texts.en:
Nayil and his wife have two children, aged 9 and 13. They both work as teachers at a local school. Six years ago, they decided to become farmers in their spare time to raise additional income. They raise sheep and cattle to resell, and also sell byproducts such as milk and wool. With the extra income, they are able to send their children to school and pay for their fees. Nayil is determined to send them to school because he wants his children to have more opportunities to achieve their goals.

Nayil has applied to VFAC for a loan so that he can buy furniture for his home. He has long wanted to be able to furnish is home, and is hoping that is loan will be approved.  

Nayil thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To furnish his home.

loans.name: Medza

texts.en:
Medza lives in Tiribe, Kenya, and earns a living buying and selling chickens. She sells them to restaurants, diners and other shops. 

Thanks to the high quality of her chickens, her business is starting to make headway. However, Medza is struggling to make enough money through her work to get ahead and help her family.

Medza has applied for a loan to buy more chickens, to keep up her supply and stay in business. Hew goal is to own and manage a shop one day.

loans.use: to buy chickens to sell.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en: Luvuno is a merchant who makes a living selling mainly fish, fruits and vegetables. She has done this work for more than 10 years from her place in a popular market in Tiribe, where she sells fresh products to her customers every day. Luvuno is a very hardworking person who makes an effort every day from very early in the morning when she begins her work. She is requesting this loan to be able to buy fish, fruits and vegetables so she can continue working and giving her customers good products.

loans.use: to buy fish, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Kedoshi Group

texts.en:
Kedoshi is a group of 12 farmers in Kakamega South District represented by Felda. The group has six women and six men. Felda is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant a ½ acre of maize, millet and sorghum. Felda joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Felda joined One Acre Fund so that she could access the best input prices and grow enough food for the family. 

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Felda was only able to harvest a 1/2 bag of maize per 1/4 acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, she was able to harvest four bags per 1/4 acre! She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send her children to school and buy a cow. Felda’s group members will each receive input loans of a ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive inputs for six acres of maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Zuma

texts.en:
Zuma is 31 years old. He is married to Sudi Kazungu and they have five children. He lives with her family in Samburu, Mombasa, Kenya. He is very hard-working to ensure he can reach his goals.
He owns a charcoal stall where he buys and sells firewood and charcoal, a business he has been doing for four years, hence he has gained a wide variety of customers. He is requesting a loan amounting of KES 50,000 to buy sacks of charcoal and firewood in stock.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoals and firewood in stock.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is from Tiribe. She’s married and living with her husband. She owns a cosmetic store and sells general items at home. She’s a very hardworking, very honest woman. 
Her dream had always been to have a store and to sell beverages and general merchandise and now thanks to her work and effort she has her own store. Umazi is requesting the loan to expand part of her living room in order to stock more products, meet customer demand and increase daily sales to thus continue helping her family.

loans.use: to enlarge her store and to purchase cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Humphrey

texts.en:
Humphrey is 58 years old, married, and a father of five children. For the last two years, he has earned a living by selling water to Malindi residents. He earns a monthly profit of KES. 5,050. 

He was introduced to Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) by a credit officer and he is applying for his second loan of 30,000 KES to purchase a bigger water tank which is capable of holding more litres of water to sell to his clients.

He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay for school fees for his last born child. Humphrey's goal for the future is to own a well-established water depot in the area, so as to help improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a bigger water tank which is capable of holding more litres of water to sell to his clients.

loans.name: Frida

texts.en:
Frida is 34 years old, married, and a mother of one child. For the last two years, she has earned a living by selling cosmetics in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of KES 7,350. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and is applying for her first loan of KES. 20,000, to buy additional stock for her business such as hair weaves, beauty makeup, nail polish, and deodorant to sell to her customers. 

She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay for her child's school fees as well as expand her business. Her goal for the future is to continue growing her business so that she can help give her family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her cosmetics business

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 33 years old. He is married and has been blessed with two school-going children.

Charles operates a retail shop which sells cycle spares within Katito town. He has been doing this business for the last five years. He comfortably makes a monthly income of 12,000 Kenyan shillings. He is taking out his third loan with KADET Ltd, which he will use to increase the value of his stock by purchasing more spare parts.
